text: The servers in this place are great they all know what they're doing and are very nice. The food is great and the atmosphere is very relaxed. And the food comes fairly fast. I love this place definitely recommend

I've noticed the low ratings but have to say that I've had pretty good experiences here so far. It is hard to get excellent service for a family of 6 but I've had good experiences here.   We normally have breakfast meals and have been satisfied for the most part (as most other places, they can cut down in the amount of butter added with griddle items).  Finally, I thoroughly enjoyed the French fries-- I'm sure they use the same oil for shrimp & chicken strips-- just a nice balance of flavor.

I really appreciate something that never changes.  Perkins has been the same since I was in high school.  I would ditch class with my girlfriend and we'd come and drink coffee and split the appetizer sampler or the chicken fingers melt.  In fact, the only thing that has changed is that there is no longer a smoking section in the back.  Breakfast is good- French toast and bacon, eggs Benedict, build your own omelets- actually typing about it is making me long for it tremendously.  The appetizer sampler is still a compellation of tasty fried nonsense, but it is satisfying.  I like the idea that you can order an entire pie and eat it at the table.  I've never done so, but I have seen it done.  The only word to describe the service is: fine.  I believe they're still open 24 hours, and I'm noticing that I must have an affiliation for that characteristic.  Good food any time, as long as you realize that you're eating at a Denny's in disguise.

I was at this Perkins about a month ago and was not happy But thought I would give it another try. The first time the table wasn't clean, waitress had to be told twice her order was up because she was talking to  co worker and not paying attention, and I had to go to the counter to get my bill. Again the service was very slow. The waitress said she would be right back twice, then went to another table to take their order. I got up and left but the manager was standing at the front counter and didn't even look up until I said the service was real slow and his response was "REALLY". Both times this place was not busy and if they are open 24 hours then they need to staff it properly. Needless to say I will never go back again. I went to Denny's and had a nice dinner, with good food and fast service!
When hubby and I crave for comfort food like country fried steaks, pancakes, or pies, we go to Perkins! The menu has nothing fancy; it's just good homestyle cooking.

Was staying at the comfort inn next to Perkins and the clerk told me they gave 10% off for guests. I figure I'd get a late night burger and I wasn't disappointed. I called and ordered. It was coming off the grill in the time it took me to walk over. Burger was good and staff was friendly.

Now that I have kids, Perkins has become our #1 favourite restaurant. It's got lots of selection with good quantity. The quality, is not high end gourmet, not at all, but it's a simple meal at a good price. Think, Dennys, if Dennys was actually good. Kids eat free on weekends which is great. There's plenty of selection to cater to whatever mood you may be in.  Basically, it's just a casual family bakery restaurant. Like an all American type place. Home cooking style, except you don't have to do it , haha. All in all, I've always left satisfied.

If you don't know about Perkins, give it a google.  This is a franchise chain type thing.  Really a slightly nicer version of Denny's, with all that entails (paying at the register.  The pie counter.  The mega menu with lots of inserts and featured specials.  Menu pictures that look delicious and nothing like what you actually get served).  And I know your ass has been to Denny's, so I'm not saying anything else.    My dining companion (hey sexy) and I eat here every now and then.  I want someone to explain something to me.  Ready?  Here it goes:  WHO ARE ALL THE DAMN PEOPLE EATING AT PERKINS AT 11pm on WEEKDAY?  Where do you all come from?   I mean, you're not high school kids, or college kids.  You're real people, lots of husbands and wives.  What kind of fucking jobs do you do?  Is that your day off?    Please, I thought dinner time in the midwest was 6pm sharp.  Who are you fucking people?
It was good! I got the chicken fingers with fries, chicken was nice and tender, fries were really good! i would go back

We always have a great meal here. .i love breakfast anytime and they do that!  We also don't eat pork and most all breakfast restaurants serve bacon ham sausage all pork but Perkins is ahead of the game and has yummy flavorful chicken sausages!, Thank you Perkins for thinking of everyone!  We also love their turkey dinners. .stuffing cranberry sauce! I ask for extra and hubby gives me his too!  Cranberry with a bit of turkey yum! Mashed taters and gravy on all.  He has veal cutlets too i think and every meal has been a great. .pie too!  If we have room that is!  Nice family atmosphere not cramped love the choice of a booth!  Servers friendly.
They have the best pancakes.  Service is hit or miss as is the food, but I love their pancakes.  They have a kids menu with good variety and evenings where kids eat free.
Great breakfast with fantastic service, try the Sunrise burger. The coffee is fresh and hot!
Very nice waitress. The Chef Salad is not on the menu any longer but they graciously made a delicious one for me.

Dry burger.  No kick in the kickin' chicken sandwich.  The food took a very long time to come out. Kid's pancakes were ok, I guess.  I like the carafe of coffee they left on our table.  If you are in transit and looking to eat outside the airport, there are a lot better places on Barlow trail than this place.

I come here frequently at late hours due to work schedules (not an irritable drunk)! The servers work very hard, but on shifts after 8PM they are abysmally understaffed. Therefore, expect to wait 15-20 minutes for your order to be taken.

Who knew this late night restaurant would have such a d......good chicken sandwich?!! Sorry KFC but I found a new love in my life so GOODBYE!   Wowww....I have been at this fully renovated location twice already and I have ordered the chicken strips melt, what a wonderful discovery ladies and gentlemen, since I tried it the first time I keep craving it......it is crispy chicken strips (when they say crispy they really mean it, the right way though, not the dry kind that cracks your mouth) applewood smoked bacon (also nice and crispy), pepperjack cheese and a chipotle ranch dressing, should I say more?? It comes in a sourdough bread (which is good) but as a personal preference I ask for whole wheat bread........but wait!.....I haven't finished yet, please ask for sweet potatoes fries as your side, without a doubt, they are such a wonderful surprise, they are all crinkled, so crispy with a soft sweet potatoe mash in its natural form on the inside, you can even see the little strings the sweet potatoe has, they reminded a little bit of thanksgiving ;) The staff has been very nice also both times I have been there.

Perkins omelettes look exactly like they do in the picture on the menu -- like plastic.  They actually taste pretty good (not great), but the entire manufactured notion of the food preparation at this chain creeps me out, and makes me wonder how processed their ingredients are.  The food is average, and it's a great place to go if you're searching for a 24-hour spot.  The prices seem a bit high for diner fare, perhaps in part because they include extras like muffins or toast with their meals.  The service is good and it's clean, but nothing special.

Terrible service, waited an hour and a half for cold food which came after people who have gotten there after us started leaving because they'd already gotten their food. The waitress handed us food that was touching her shirt, not to  mention that she was all sweaty. By far the worst Mother's Day brunch we've ever had. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

I have been here many times for breakfast and let me tell you it's my fave. If you want breakfast try the tremendous twelve. The wait is about 10 to 15 on the weekend mornings but it is worth it. I can not speak for the dinner service but check it out if you are in the mood for a solid breakfast!  You will find a large percentage of people who are here on the weekend are senior or regulars.

I was just there this morning.  I asked them if they had wifi because I had some work to do and they said yes, they had free wifi.  After I ordered, I opened up my laptop and decided to get connected but it was not working.  The nice server said that they would need to reboot it.  10 minutes later, nothing yet.  The server said it takes a while for the system to reboot.  20 minutes later, no internet and no work done.  Do not come here if you are looking for a wifi connection.  The food was so-so... I ordered my eggs over medium and they came runny.  Other than that, the server was very nice!

I came here last Sept.25. My server is so rude, I ordered HEARTY MAN COMBO, I was supposed to get a pancake instead of the toast and I told him to please change it to pancake and he told me with not so nice tone "You have to pay for it because it's served already" and I said Sure I will pay for it because I was really craving for a pancake that day. So he went to the Kitchen and then he came back to my table and TOOK THE 4pcs. OF TOAST FROM MY PLATE WITH BARE HANDS AND NOT EVEN SAY ANYTHING. Is he not supposed to say Excuse me or something nice? I was holding my temper that time. It's my birthday and I didn't want to ruin it. Hope the supervisor will teach the servers specially Husseini tons of manners or to remind them to be always nice to customers. Im not sure of his name but that's what it is shown on my receipt.

This place has typical  greasy, heavy, diner food. The serving sizes are huge, which would be nice if the food wasn't heavy enough already. The service was fine, but I was left feeling guilty after only eating a little bit of my dish.

How shall I start this?  For starters, the customer service was the worst I have ever encountered. Buddy bitched when a few tables didn't leave him a tip, maybe he should try smiling and be nicer in demeanour. Next, the fountain Coke taste like carbonated water and seriously taste like soap with colour. The tap water had more taste. We both ordered the Harty mans meal, the only thing good and not from box was the eggs. Hash browns and tatter totts were over done, smoked sausage was burnt beyond recognition. Like come on, try cutting thru smoke burnt sausage with a butter knife. Ain't happening! Bacon was so greasy that even after patting it down with our only 2 napkins, still was dripping. Pancakes were from box, aunt jamima batter and to salty.  After telling buddy to take it back and wanted a refund, he told us we couldn't have one. That's when I ordered to speak with management. In all fairness the manager refunded us back $5.00 and let us pick about $6.00 of goodies from the dessert menu. He excuse buddy's shity customer service and begged forgiveness. We paid the bill thanked him and decided never again.  Steer clear, worst place to eat.

I stay at a hotel across the street usually around 3 times a week and I always get a to-go order here. The food is always excellent and cheap, the staff is always nice to chat with as well. And they are open 24/7 pretty hard to beat.

Genuinely nice waiters and waitresses, and good food for the price that you pay. This place is always busy (even though there are no reviews yet for it!) lots of older folk frequent this place, but if you don't mind that and like breakfast foods then this might be a good brunch place for you.
Consistently good food and since they built the new restaurant this year, service has been pretty good.

If you go here for the muffins only,  it's 5 star. The food is never as good as I want it to be.  The cheese in the ham and cheese omelet seemed processed and the ham seemed canned.  The turkey is processed butterball. Stick with the bakery.
Rubbish service, crap tasteless food, don't waste your time or money...

Very good for breakfast. Service has always been quick and friendly. I've tried several items off of the breakfast menu and the food is good and always served hot. No complaints. Will be visiting again.

Perkins always remind me of my childhood in Winnipeg, going their for breakfast. Since I have grown-up in Calgary, there wasn't as many Perkins here as there was in Winnipeg, so nevery really got to eat there often.  I went there a few weeks ago with my cousin as we were just driving by and starving. We were seated right away, but in a booth that was a little too dated, that probably needed to be replaced (big hole on the side covered in duct tape) As hungry as we were, we had some trouble decieding what to get. Not because of lack of option, there were too many to choose from. I ended up getting a burger with fries and a side of gravy. The serving size was perfect, waste even able to finish it all. The food tasted good as well. The gravy wasnt the best and was a little cold, but with hot fries, it didnt bother me. We were checked on twice from our server and drinks were refilled before they were even empty, which I like.  Overall, it was just okay. If your looking for a cheap, sit down lunch, this place is a-okay!
Waited for 45 minutes for food to arrive and food is not up to the mark of $  we are spending

Always impressed.  Their menu changes and I try different dishes and I am always happy with them.  Staff are happy.  They are like a Denny's but not greasy at all.  They should have everyone with kids sit on one side.  That way they can all cry and yell together while the other people trying to have grown up conversations are not bothered.  HA!  Lots of parking.  They need more pie.  yum!

Like similar chain restaurants, you know what you're getting when you go to Perkins.     It's been almost 15 years since I last darkened the door of a Perkins and - if I remember correctly - that one was in Denver off Colorado Boulevard.      After being told at the nearby Walmart Lube Center that I was in for a two hour wait, I decided to have breakfast at Perkins and walked a block or two to get there.    At 715 am on a Saturday it was not busy but had a decent amount of groups of older friends and what looked like a dozen-strong book club or prayer group  crammed around a large table.    The menu is large and I settled on a special Bacon Tater omelette that came with hash browns (Holy potatoes, Batman!).   Pancakes were also included and when I asked the server if they had pumpkin pancakes that I could sub in for an upcharge, she looked at me for a long minute (I wasn't sure if she was stroking out?) and then offered a flat "no."   Just that one word.   Hilarious.   Once the food arrived, it was perfectly fine.   Acceptable.  Tasty.  But not outstanding.  The server also warmed up a bit and became more pleasant.     My only issues were these.   The syrup containers were splattered with syrup.   Those bad boys should be cleaned before every customer and secondly I was given a nearly empty ketchup bottle.   So, overall.  Perkins is OK.

There are few restaurants in Champaign-Urbana that are open 24 hours. There are the Merry Ann's/Merry-Ann's/Mary Anne's diners, but you don't feel super comfortable there with grease in the air. I love Merry Ann's diner food, but Perkin's just feels homier.   I've gone to Perkins in the middle of the night to get work done; order a snack and bottomless coffee. It's quiet, the booths are cushy, and there's pie if you need some sugar for energy.

This is so below average. The restaurant decor is out dated and worn out.  Poor service below average breakfast and how do you even screw up breakfast. Manager asked how was everything I said "just ok"he said ok did not inquire. Food did not have quality flavor it was very bland.

Years ago this wasn't such a bad place to eat. It has since, gone down the drain! It took way too long for our order to arrive, about 45 minutes. I had family visiting and they wanted to go here.. My child got the mac n cheese and it was terrible. Tasted of cheap store brand mac. It was dry and a weird orange color. I got eggs and hashbrowns which  were bland and overpriced. Not very filling either. My whole family was disappointed with the food. We won't be back.

I think this was the worst service I've ever had I went out with a friend after a movie it was about 10 o'clock we ordered and got our drinks service was slow I'd finished my iced tea and when my food came the waitress said she was going to refill it three-quarters of the way through my food about a half-hour later I finally get my iced tea my friend asked for more gravy and that took 20 minutes and we decided not to wait any longer they weren't busy so there wasn't really any excuse the omelet that I got was small and overpriced my friend was so mad she didn't even wait for me she walked out the whole experience was just terrible and I definitely won't go back
Had a wonderful brunch at Perkins off the west belt-line today. Service was good food was delicious.  Had the chicken soup 1/2 turkey sandwich and salad. Would recommend this to anyone

I wish I could give a negative rating! This place I would NOT recommend ever. The service was extremely slow for an almost - empty restaurant. The manager was rude and the food was subpar ( I've been to much better Perkins in the past). We should've just went to a drive-thru and called it a night!

Traveling and wanted to get some lunch, 2:40pm. Not many diners but plenty of staff. Some just talking, one sweeping. No one would wait on us and after 15 minutes we left. On our way out they offered us muffins.

Perkin's has had a lot of unremarkable ratings and I have to admit, almost embarrassingly, that I come to Perkin's the most for brunch.  I *only* come to Perkin's for brunch. Or, for dinner when I want to have brunch for dinner.  It's super busy for brunch on the weekends but you never need to wait long for a table.  Perkin's is a great place to go after a night of partying and when you're starving because their portions are quite large.  THEY HAVE THE BEST PANCAKES EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!! They are so delicious and light and fluffy and it comes with the most heavenly whipped butter. I also LOVE their shredded hashbrowns. They also have regular hashbrowns. The eggs and bacon/sausage are just fine and average. They always make my bacon how I love it--crispy.  When you order a coffee, they bring you an entire carafe of coffee! Hello!!! Does it get any better than that?!  They are always happy to split the bill for you and you pay at the front.   You really can't lose at Perkin's. It's not in a trendy location, mind you, so that may be a disadvantage. I really can't believe there's only one Perkin's in Calgary!
This Perkins by far has the best hashbrowns.  The staff is always friendly to us no matter what time we show up.

Our visit was nothing short of terrible. My eggs benedict came out cold, so I sent it back. When I got a new plate, it was still cold - a feat I thought was impossible. My boyfriend's meal didn't come out with the rest of the table's food. They decided to give us 20% off (two whole dollars). When the manager asked us how our experience was when we went up to pay, we told her. And she proceeded to ignore us. Not sure I have anything good to say about this place. I guess the tea was alright.

Really slow service..... I ordered breakfast carry out while passing through town.  Not only did my order take long, it sat on a shelf behind the counter until I got up and asked if that was my order.  It's not like they were busy and the staff was overworked.  There were 3 young employees having a sidebar conversation about school during my wait.  None of them were attentive or seemed concerned that I was standing there for 17 minutes.  No wonder the nearby McDonalds with their reheated food menu has higher ratings than this place.

Excellent service, staff is super nice, we were seated right away on a busy Sunday breakfast /lunch time. The restaurant is clean and they turn tables quickly. Our server, Bette, was attentive and fast with the drinks and checking to see if everything was ok  We ordered pulled pork breakfast burritos and southern chicken breakfast biscuits. Wow, there was so much food and everything was excellent.
Not my favorite place to eat. Food is frozen and microwaved as expected. If it's late and you have been having fun? Why not. But definitely not somewhere I'd pick over anything else.

I absolutely love this place. My family and I have been coming there for many many years. The food is always consistently perfect and the staff are some of the kindest you will meet. (ESP Micheal) but we love them all.

This review is for the banana cream pie we picked up to bring to a picnic today. We were pretty skeptical of going after seeing all the awful reviews but took a chance. My boyfriend and I miss the banana cream pie we used to pick up from Marie calendars in California and hoped this would be a similar substitute. The lady that rung me up was so friendly and reassured me the pie would be great. It turns out we had a hit item at the picnic we went to. Everyone kept talking about the pie as we were making our way through the savory main dishes. And boy did it disappear fast. The pie was just as delicious as Marie's. Still skeptical on dining in though...
Well, The pie is good. The coffee is good. The restroom was gross. But they did have lots of parking. My breakfast was 75% correct. As the Yelp 2 Star rating says: Meh. I've experienced better.

Not so good. Eggs were overcooked, I could not chew the whites, and the hash browns were burned on the outside and raw inside. Come here for desserts only, not breakfast. The service was excellent and friendly and the restaurant was clean. Prices were quite high, three eggs and hash browns was $14.00 with coffee.

5:30pm on Wednesday, May 10 The food was plentiful, good and reasonably priced.   Service just ok.   The bathrooms smelled like urine, the floor was sticky and looked like it hadn't been mopped in a month.  After I mentioned it to our server, nothing was done about it.   There also seemed to be a sewer gas issue in the foyer.  How unfortunate.   I had gone to the Perkins on Tiedemann and had the same understaffed experience.

Found this via Yelp; mixed reviews but we were hungry and didn't feel like driving more than we already had. Located across the street from main entrance to Univ. of Illinois in a sad, worn down neighborhood. Restaurant is older and could use more lighting. Refills were slow to come (ok, not at all). Our waitress laid her arms on the table while she took our order, commenting on her lack of a break and no food all day.  I know this is not the Ritz but server etiquette should still exist. Food was well done/seasoned and that was the main thing, else this would be 2 stars. Won't return.

To begin with, I wish Yelp! would change the meaning of the stars.  Two stars is "Meh. I've experienced better" and three stars jumps to "A-OK."  Perkins is somewhere in between.  The menu for breakfast seems pretty extensive.  I ordered a platter that included smoked sausage (greasy), sausage (greasy and bland), eggs (done okay), bacon (spot on), breakfast potatoes (pretty good), and pancakes (so-so).  I like that they leave a pot of coffee on the table, rather than having you wait for refills from the wait staff.  It would have been even better if the pot was full and the coffee was good, neither of which was the case.  My waitress was efficient and personable.  Seemed more like a pro waitress rather than some of these student types that serve with the attitude that says, "I'm only doing this until I graduate and start my money-making career, so don't expect much."  Again, not all student wait staff are like that but some are.  The place seemed clean and it wasn't very busy for a Saturday morning breakfast.  I've wanted to try Perkins and must admit i went there today only because Courier Cafe was closed.  I will return to Perkins, as there were some other things on the menu I'd like to try and because the experience wasn't completely a bust.  Although, I am usually a member of the Clean Plate Club, I did leave behind one piece of smoked sausage, a sausage link, some potatoes, and half the pancakes.  That says something.  SECOND VISIT: My first reaction holds true the second time.  The coffee wasn't very good.  The eggs were okay and the potatoes decent.  Bacon once again was perfect.  The muffin french toast was awful. and was left unfinished.

Typical American style restaurant.  By that I mean extra large quantity and lots of fried stuff.  Went there the other day for lunch and was happy to find out they serve Breakfast all day!  shared an appetizer platter that had fried spring rolls, fried cheese, fried chicken breast pieces and yes, fried string beans.    For main we each had 2 eggs, hash potatoes, fried chicken on biscuit (2 big pieces) with some white sauce. ($12.95).  Was too much, but who don't like fried food?
Bacon and eggs were normal :-) Table was dirty as usual. They give a carafe of coffee, awesome!

This is NOT the place to go for your lunch hour. They are incredibly slow and they really don't care that they are. We were not ready to order when the waitress asked us the first time so she said she would come back in a few minutes. Yeah, more like 20 minutes!!   I ordered the new bacon, mushroom and onion skillet and I loved it. It has an Alfredo sauce over potatoes, grilled mushrooms & onion, bacon and cheddar cheese. I know it sounds like a heart attack on a plate but it was so good. I had a blueberry muffin also and it came out hot with butter on the side.   Although I was very pleased with the meal the reason I am giving such a low rating is for the service. I ran out of water and was looking for my waitress to ask for more. It took a really long time for her to show up again. It also took more than a half an hour for our food to come out of the kitchen after we ordered. With only an hour for lunch that is unacceptable.

I had a giant Raspberry Cream muffin in the morning with a piping hot cup of coffee.  What a great start to a good morning.  They serve "mammoth muffins" for around $2.30.  They had the typical kinds like Banana Nut, but also Cranberry Nut and Carrot, which I really wanted to try but I couldn't imagine that cream cheese frosting sitting too well at 8am.  Another time.  Their muffins are big... I guess "mammoth" sized, but instead of an insanely gigantic muffin all I can picture is an adorable woolly mammoth.  Anyways, I thought the muffin was cream-filled, but it came with a mini scoop of butter on the side.  Not the same, and I didn't slab it on.  It tasted great the way it was.  With a cup of coffee my breakfast was within $5.  By the way their pies and cookies are amazing, especially their FRENCH SILK pie.  All I've had here are their desserts and that is fine by me!

Manager should be fired, fired, fired.  Staffing is horrible.  My family and I came in at 1030 at night after a long day at the ICU visiting a sick relative. There were probably 10-15 people in the restaurant. The couple in front of me were able to get get a seat however, when she came back to seat us, the hostess told us we had to wait 20 minutes to be seated because they only had one server. I said there was no way I can wait around with a tired, cranky, and hungry 3 year old.  It did not help.  How about hiring some more folks??? Anyway, that was enough to keep me away forever. On a positive note, they do give a military discount.  They get the 2 stars for that.

What you are about to read is a true story.  "Welcome to Perkins, what can we get for you?"  "Hi!  I'd like to order the chicken fingers."  "Sorry, we're out of chicken."  "You're out of chicken?"  "Yup."  "Okay... how about a bowl of ice cream."  "Sorry, we're out of ice cream, too."  "You're out of ice cream and chicken?"  "Yup."  "Okay... do you have any French Fries left?"  "Yes, we do."  "Alright, I'll have that."  (comes back after a while with the fries)  "Great, can I have a fork for this?"  "Sure." (comes back after a few minutes) "I'm sorry, we're out of forks."  "You're out of forks???"  "Yeah, sorry..."  I don't care what the food tastes like, but if an establishment runs out of forks, there is something wrong.

The mood was for an american breakfast, so Perkins was on the way from where we were coming. Hence, we stopped by to have a big breakfast.  The start was excellent as there is a huge parking and the place is quite big. We walk in and lined up to be seated and were found a place easily. From here it was all down hill for me, as I experienced one of the worst customer service possible.  The server was not friendly and all about tips with bad service. He put the menu on the table for us to make a selection and left.  We ordered scrambled eggs with pancakes and Classic Eggs Benedict and told him if we can get some water as he didn't bring it earlier. As he was caring more things and our 2 glasses of water in one hand, the water was dripping out on to his fingers and leaving darker dirty finger marks on the glass.   The food was here after a bit of waiting and the scrambled eggs with pancakes were fine but the Classic Eggs Benedict had peameal bacon or ham slices (I don't eat pork so I am not sure which one was it) in between the egg and toast. I inquired and the waiter argued it said in the menu and will not making me a new one, all he will do is take it out and bring the same plate. He had already taken the menus away and I was not able to check it, as he kept arguing it being on the menu.  Below was the extract from the menu online and there is no mention of meat in the eggs, I have also brought in the * comment.  ===== Classic Eggs Benedict* A traditional favorite served with choice of hash browns or breakfast potatoes and choice of fruit or Mammoth MuffinÂ®.  *NOTICE: Eggs served over easy, basted, poached, sunny-side up, or soft boiled and hamburgers and steaks that are served rare or medium-rare may be undercooked and will only be served upon the consumer's request if permitted by health department regulations. Whether dining out or preparing food at home, consuming raw or undercooked meats, poultry, seafood, shellfish or eggs may increase your risk of foodborne illness. ======  I lost my appetite from then onwards and when we paid he was expecting a tip. He didn't see any tip on the receipt and just walked away without acknowledging and angry.   It is sad to see a good restaurant going downhill even the greasy spoons fixup or change anything wrong in the meals.

We had been coming here for a while and it's been getting progressively worse, but this most recent visit probably put us off this Perkins in Middleburg Heights for good. Food was terrible. Eggs were cold, biscuits were too chewy and slightly stale. Service was even worse. It took forever to get a hostess to seat us, forever to get our order taken, forever to get our food, and even longer to get our check. Hardly an apology from this cranky wait staff.

Two important words.  " bacon fest"   they had some bacon themed new menu items so I did not look at the rest of the menu.  Went with a pan scramble sort of thing that came with bacon gravy strips of bacon eggs and tater tots.   quite good.  Would have been better with traditional chunks of potatos. And was b bit salty. But over all satisfying
Its Perkins. I keep my expectations in line.  If we are looking for something better than fast food and we don't want to spend much we come here. There is a large menu with lots of variety.

The Southwest omelet was fresh and hot, perfect for breakfast.  The chicken and egg was hot, the fruit dish fresh, and the toast hearty and not pre-buttered.   The onion garnish was perfectly grilled, and the light trace of sour cream added flavor without overpowering.   Service was friendly and efficient.  Update.  We had not been back in over a year, which is itself a kind of rating...neither of us had missed it, nor remembered it as being a 'go-to' destination.  We went because we happened to be in the area.   The staff on this Sunday morning was efficient and attentive, but the underlying attitude towards food quality was unclear.   The fruit side dish, which was so remarkably fresh in my first review, contained a partially rotten strawberry clearly visible to the server.  The waitress promptly replaced the bowl with what looked like the same dish, sans strawberry; but the remainder of the fruit still looked like yesterday's leftovers, including strawberry juice diffused into the cantaloupe.  She politely reassured us that 'strawberries go bad quickly'.  True, but even a so-so chef would cut out and remove the rot, and a so-so server would never deliver it to a guest.  And a good restaurant would only serve fresh fruit.  The manager agreed with us as well...but he seemed to be neither surprised nor alarmed.    On a side note, Mrs. B. is working off some heartburn from the corned beef hash.  My omelet was adequate albeit a bit salty, but clearly unlike the one that prompted my original review.   This review averages the original 4-star with a 2-star; I doubt there will be a third visit.

My son had games in Cleveland... and thought we could eat here and burn some time. He has to be at games 1 hour and 30 minutes before and the rink was 11 minutes away. It took them 40 minutes to get breakfast food out to us.. and then we realized we had no utensils.. waiter Eric was huffy and said "they should have been there when you were seated" .. well their not!!! We finally get them .. scuff down our $40 breakfast for 3... yeah expensive.. and now we need a receipt like yesterday.. .. so finally I was going to wait that the waiter Eric may or not be around in the near future... so I got a receipt.. bad service old food!!

I've been here about 5 times now and they have been pretty consistent with their service and food. I've been here when they were really busy and food took longer to get to the table, However, they did let us know, but at that capacity it should be expected. The most recent time I was here it wasn't too busy and there were only a couple servers so the food was quick, but there wasn't much service at all.  My favourite thing about Perkins is their Tater Tots! Because of my love for Tater Tots, I have tried the Big Bacon Smasher and the Big Country Smasher, and both were delicious! I have also tried the Southern Fried Chicken Biscuit Breakfast and thought it was good, very filling. There was too much biscuit for me, but I enjoyed the combination of everything on the plate. I have tried, and really like their Mediterranean Omelette. The last time I got the Chicken Strips sandwich with Tater Tots and ate half so it was good for a lighter lunch.  They have a very big menu so there is always something new to try! I also like that if you order a coffee, they bring you a whole carafe. Makes it easier than waiting for a refill.   The location is great as it's close to the airport. I usually end up here for breakfast with the family when I fly in or out of Pearson.

Came here a few times very early in the morning after work.   At that location were almost no customers during my few visits around that time.   With that being said, the service was fast.   Yet, to me, the food seemed good, but it isn't all that great. I ordered from the breakfast menu.   The deserts were also not that great, like the milk shake, it tasted more like a "water-shake" then rather creamy.   It's a nice spot to go to around here, because nothing is really open overnight or very early in the morning.   Great and fast service, however.

A couple of nights ago we had a business meeting at Perkins. I guess we were all tired and just didn't have the energy to traipse around town looking for fine dining. So Perkins it was.   I have to start by telling you that our server was EXCELLENT. She was on the ball with everything and extremely friendly. To be completely honest, I didn't have high expectations going in, but because of her fantastic service, our server made me rethink my impression of Perkins.   Their menu per se doesn't have a whole lot vegetarian on it that isn't breakfast. I asked our server to get the kitchen to make me a wrap and they did. The wrap was alright. Nothing to write home about, but the fact that they custom-made it for me was a nice touch.   The prices were reasonable and the environment was okay. Nothing fancy, kinda like a diner meets a Smitty's, but it did the job.   Overall, Perkins turned out to be a bit better than I thought! Like I said, the service was great and the overall experience was okay.   I may not go back any time soon, but I probably wont hesitate as much as I did initially if I end up there in the future.

I had thee BEST waitress EVER here!!! I mean she did everything to keep our kids happy!! You sometimes need a person who is naturally friendly and warming to appreciate your meal. The food was good and inexpensive I will be back. Especially, since I know kids eat free on Wednesdays and Saturday after 3pm that's just a double bonus lol.

Newly remodeled and it looks great!  The restaurant itself just completed a much needed facelift yesterday. Food is your typical Perkins fare. Not the best food you've ever eaten but not horrible either. The staff is very friendly and fun to interact with, so that and the remodel gets them an extra star.
I grew up going here, loved it as a kid. Maybe it's nostalgia...but it is still a favorite. Nothing special, kind of similar to Denny's...but if you are near by, it is reasonable.
Mmmmmm. A whole cherry pie at midnight. Can't beat that.  Don't eat anything else here.
For a chain restaurant the food is very good. The staff are generally friendly & helpful. On weekends go early or late they get very busy

The food is consistently good. I come here everytime I am in the area. It can get quite busy and the service slows. I love the hashbrowns! The muffins are ginormous. Decently priced breakfast for the portion you get.
Always good food! Service is good most of the time. Wish they brought back mini chimis

The food is pretty good. But the staff and customer service really needs to improve to make this place better. We had a waiter that pretty much made it obvious that he either didn't like his job or he didn't want to serve us. but anyways, I wasn't really bothered by the slow and unenthusiastic service....I understand, maybe he had a bad day. I felt bad that he had to deal with the family behind us who pretty much got fed up that they weren't getting serviced... One of the customers then went on to make a pretty racist comment, saying that the waiter clearly didn't know English (when really he only had an accent... Which has nothing to do with the slow service). The restaurant  kind of tried to make the situation better by giving one of the plates of food on the house but I feel like this just encourages rude behaviour from customers. I really hope they can get their act together in terms of the customer service here because the food is great but if the service is poor then it just makes the whole experience unpleasant

I went to the Farmers Market on the square in Painesville and wanted somewhere to sit, read and eat lunch. Car GPS says Perkins is a mile away!  Lived here over a year and never knew that. It is tucked away on a very quiet part of Mentor Ave. Service is nice and friendly. Food would do the chain proud. In my last two visits we have had lemon blueberry pancakes, fish and shrimp and half a ham swiss sandwich w chicken noodle soup and chocolate French silk pie. Plus I took muffins home last week. Every bit of it was delish!  I will say the broth in the soup was loose gelatin thick but it still tasted good!  Highly recommend!

The server had an awesome attitude (a little awkward - may not always match the customer but he tries!). The food is typical for a Perkins...filling but nothing special.   My tip: make sure your definition of over medium matches the cooks. My eggs weren't even fully over easy. Can you say "slimy"?

Apparently Perkins is a fairly popular chain restaurant in the Midwest, but I just went for the first time this weekend. My friend and I were famished after landing in Cleveland and Perkins was the first restaurant we saw on our drive to Youngstown. My friend had been there before and said it was decent so we stopped for a bite to eat. We each got a bowl of chicken noodle soup and shared some fried santa fe appetizer. It wasn't anything special and reminded me a lot of Friday's, but it hit the spot. My friend did comment that they had amazing muffins as well, but I didn't try them.

I only come here late at night, so I can't speak for other times, but this place has potential as the best alternative to Merry Ann's (seriously, Merry Ann's sucks). Late night specials include half-off appetizers and pie and all you can eat pancakes. Food is good quality and tasty. Good old-timey music that you would expect from an American diner, clean facilities, warm atmosphere, pleasant decor, usually not crowded. Probably super safe too since I often see police come here for food and coffee, which is important for me since I'm a girl who comes here alone at night. Whatever gave this place such a bad overall rating is definitely not here anymore from what I can see. One of the servers, Moira, is super nice and friendly. One thing that could be a downside is that servers might leave you alone for long periods of time when it's very late, but I personally don't find that an issue.

Great hangover or late night food. I could eat breakfast for every meal so I love all the omelettes, pancakes, bacon and hash browns. The waitresses that have served us have put up with everyone very well.

Took 4 minutes of standing at the podium with the menus and what not before anyone said hi or anything and seated me. Someone must have called in. I sat at my table for ten minutes then and had a question about if the promo in the website was offered at this location. I eventually saw my server but she was busy taking plates from current diners. So I got to a total of fifteen minutes in the restaurant without my order being taken. It wasn't busy. So I left.

Congratulations, Perkins! You've won my award for worst food in CU.  The winner is: a 1/4" chicken patty that spurts grease when bitten into! And said patty was definitely not a normal breast. More like old school McNuggets.  YUCK.

Ok, let me start off and say Ive always been a Perkins fan, I used to go to the one off East Washington so I dont want to seem like a jerk, but what happened to this one? I had breakfast today and very little was good about it. I feel bad because of all the good memories, Its too bad this wasnt one of them.  Service - Fair to good. Our waitress was very busy but attentive and nice. Food came out hot and punctual. 8/10  Food Quality - Ok, heres where I might hurt feelings. I ordered the Steak and Eggs. The goods: Bacon was crunchy and hot, and the pancakes albeit much smaller then I remember tasted great. Lots of butter. The bads: Everything else. The eggs were not scrambled, they were formed into a patty. The hashbrowns with cheese on top had a weird aftertaste (kind of bitter, soapy or something), and the steak, oh my god, was THE worst steak Ive ever attempted to eat. I am a steak fanatic so its my bad that I thought Perkins might suprise me (like Norms diner in LA, great t bone there). Nope, it was tough, tasted gamey, and soooo chewy. I spent so much time chewing everything else went cold. It was cooked to my liking its just they have horrible cuts of meat. 2/10 (0/10 without bacon and pancakes)  Price - For what I got not good at all. I paid $12 for "steak" and eggs and $3 for a side of bacon (4 strips). Coffee was priced well. I expect either a smaller steak of better quality then the 7oz piece of garbage I got. 1/10  Experience/Vibe - Typical of any Perkins, we weren't offered to have a booth which I think is a no brainer, some people prefer booths. A little cramped but not too bad. 6/10  Overall - 17/40  MANAGEMENT PLEASE LISTEN!!! Please your meat elsewhere. Ive never had such a tough piece of "steak" in my life. I am anti A1 sauce cause I like the taste of steak as it is. I actually used A1 because of how nasty I felt trying to choke this down. I can't believe you call that steak, the only way I will ever buy that false steak again is if the world ran out of dog food and my dog was starving. Even then Id feel bad for my dog and probably end up giving him the hiemlich maneuver after choking on it.  1 star, sorry Perkins, you might have just lost a customer to Dennys. Ill still patronize your bakery but as for meals I think I am done. Hire a meat manager or fire the one you have, please.

My friend took me here today and I'm not complaining. Got the build a breakfast with over easy eggs, turkey bacon, shredded potatoes, and buttermilk pancakes. They bring over an entire jug of coffee and leave it at your table and the pancakes are super fluffy! I was pretty much shocked when the bill came because it was only $10.95. If you want a cozy breakfast nook where you can really relax, this is the place.

The food was really good, but the service wasn't great. It took a long time to place my order, then I had to wait to eat because I didn't have silverware. I witnessed other tables having similar issues, so maybe it was just an off night.

Arriving at 4:30pm on a Saturday afternoon, I was hoping no one would mistake me for a senior citizen. LOL Perkins is best known for it's breakfast food and I would recommend sticking to that. My aunt and I ordered dinner entrees and they were ok, but the breakfasts here are better. I had the grilled Alaskan cod with bacon green beans and herb rice as sides. The cod was actually dipped in flour then fried in oil which was disappointing. My other option was the battered cod and that might have been tastier with probably as many calories. The green beans were tasty too most likely because they were slathered in butter and bacon. Yes, bacon does make everything better! My aunt had the turkey dinner which looked good and she said was like having Thanksgiving dinner.   The service here tonight was disappointing. After our waitress took brought out our drinks, she disappeared. I had to ask another waitress twice if we could finally order. The meal did arrive quickly which made up for the delay in ordering.   I'm giving this Perkins 3 stars because of the poor service and the fact that the entree I had was only OK.

My wife and I went to Perkins tonight around 7:45pm. There were very few customers so I was hoping we would have good service. Our drinks came out fast as did our food. The food was good and hit the spot. The problems came after we got our food.   Our waitress disappeared. I'm not sure if she was taking a break or busy doing other tasks but she was nowhere to be found. We were wanting to order dessert which is one of the perks of going to Perkins as they have good pie and other goodies. Unfortunately we have had this type of service in the past. We did inform the manager about our disappearing waitress.  Another problem I have with the staff is that if you order a muffin with your meal, don't expect to get dessert. The waiter/waitress will suggest that you 'probably don't want dessert' since you had a muffin. This has happened to us on multiple visits from multiple waitresses. I'm not sure if this is how they train their staff here, but it's really not a good way to run a business. I want to give them my money for more food and tip well, but they make it very difficult to do this.  I don't care if you have the best food on the planet. If your service is lousy, then it ruins the whole experience.

Cannot list all the times over 20 years we ended up at Perkins!  After a long day at the University, as both students and staff.  In the middle of the night when neither of us could sleep.  When my in-laws had a craving for French Silk (and omg, the number of pies I bought... it's just not quantifiable!).  When the ice had brought down all the electrical, once, and the roads were sheets of ice, a death-defying trek to Perkins, who promptly saved Christmas, one year!  Whenever we couldn't make up our mind about anywhere else, the answer was always Perkins, and this location (on University) always met the call.  A warm pancake stack, with an ice cream scoop sized wad of butter melting in!  The aforementioned French Silk pie, a slice of it just as a treat.  Even their hot turkey plate-- a real Butterball turkey, slow cooked, with amazing "fixin's".  I mean... food doesn't have to be froo froo for me in order to be _good_, _wholesome_, and made with love.  So many meals I've had here, and I'd say that the vast majority of them have been something special!  Perkins is super reasonable on price.  The restaurant is a little dated, now, but you just _can't_ judge this book by its cover.  Because there's love underneath what they do, here, and if you can't find something to enjoy, you just aren't trying hard enough (or you're trying _too_ hard to be a snob! ;D).

The hearty man combo was great I liked the seasoned potato cubes and kielbasa but I was disappointed in the bacon I received 1-1/2 strips - I guess if I was cutting down that would be satisfactory but it is the "Hearty" man combo ain't no cutting down here And I was pleased to find out I had a choice of pancakes - when syrup is labeled "Maple" I expect maple syrup but no one was sure Don't skimp on the butter either butter spread ain't the same But I liked it that on a Sunday 2 walk into a restaurant for breakfast and are seated pretty quickly Wow There was a bit of a lag between ordering and receiving our food but come on it was almost noon on Sunday I'll forgive you

I came here to kill my late night craving of pancakes.   When I arrived, there was no line yet it took them four minutes to seat me at a table. Once I sat it took them another ten minutes to take my order. My pancakes took about five minutes to come out.  Pancakes were good though they weren't out of this world.  I give these restaurant a three... food was good though two points deducted due to the fact that they had me waiting in an empty restaurant.
Nice decor,  good food and fast service, but the waiter was a little on the rough side for personality.

The food isn't great. But the never-ending pot of coffee and 24 hour schedule meant that I spent a ton of time here around finals.   Just don't be a jerk: leave a fat tip after you've been sitting in someone's section all night studying. They'll appreciate it.
Went there again the other night. Looking more and more rundown and the floor was filthy.

Had a great brunch (10am) here. I didn't want breakfast items and they have a full menu all day long. The service was fast & friendly (forgot the server's name)  Our food was excellent! Much better than we expected. We had the Monticello shrimp and the tilapia with shrimp.  The Monticello shrimp had angel hair pasta and sliced mushrooms in a creamy garlic wine sauce. The tilapia was seasoned well and served with rice pilaf and grilled asparagus. The dishes came with a side of garlic toast (that was also quite good!)  We've eaten at this Perkins before but this was the tastiest it's been (my compliments to the chef!)   2 meals + 2 coffees and our total bill was $29.   Perkins is on Bagley Rd, convenient to the I-71. Lots of parking. Restaurant is clean and inviting.

The food was good but there were definitely some issues. Our server was great- super nice and attentive. However the kitchen lacked. I found a hair in my food. They brought me out a new one with no problems which I appreciated, but then the grapes were dirty. When I finished, there was dirt in the bottom of the bowl. Even through all this, it still won't stop me from coming back. Like I said the food was exceptional and so was the service. I work at a restaurant so I understand. They were probably just having a bad day.

I picked up my friends at the airport from a late flight coming into Cleveland for a wedding and we choose to grab a bite to eat late night on a Saturday night sometime after midnight.  The place was extremely busy, however, the associate manager Eric greeted us at the door with a friendly smile and allowed us to choose a booth or table.  We had six people total with us and we waited at the door for a short wait until we sat at a combined group of tables in the back section of the restaurant away from the crowds. Eric asked us what we wanted to drink and told us our server Kristina will be right with us.  My wife asked if she could have a hot tea and Eric bought it out right away and even asked us a second time if anyone needed anything right away since my friend mentioned we just got into Cleveland on a late flight.  We felt welcome and it was nice to relax in an area not so busy as the rest of the restaurant.  Our waitress came over and was very nice and allowed us a moment to sit and talk before being rushed to order.  When our order arrived it came out all at once with Eric and Kristina both together coming to our table with our food.  They were very attentive asking if we needed refills or extra napkins.  Eric even took the time to talk to us about our hometown and talked a little about what Cleveland has to offer while in town.  I thought this was nice to go the extra mile make my party feel at home.  We ordered dessert and Kristina told us that we did not have brownies for the brownie delight but Eric brought us out the dessert so they must have been able to find some in the back.  All in all an excellent experience so late at night at this Perkins in Middleberg Heights.  I am glad we choose here and I will be back again in the am with my business clients since it is close to the airport and the staff is friendly and very accommodating.

Perkins is like Denny's but less gross and I love Denny's so I super-love Perkins.  Our server, Rebekah, was very attentive, quick, and accommodating despite it being packed for brunch rush.  This isn't a fine dining place or a health store, so know what to expect. It's great for what it's trying to do.  Side note: There are these cheesecake stick things on the Sweet Starter section of the menu that are A+

It's been years sine the last time I was at Perkins.  This was awesome.  Great food. Great Price. Great service.  Chocolate silk pie to die for.  I will be back for sure.  Today on the menu we had some buttermilk pancakes, bacon, scrambled eggs and sausage.  However they are much more than breakfast and let me express this place was busy busy busy.  But how refreshing to have a waiter with a smile and positive attitude, because that goes a long way.  As a guest at this outing i was as pleased as one can get when the desert arrived, because all things chocolate make me a happy yelper.
Dont water your time with this place.  Unless you like loud lines of obnoxious people and crappy service steer clear.

Food was very good. Friday morning breakfast was about half full   Our server christin was fabulous! My blueberry muffin was freshly baked and Marvelous!!! The inside needs updating but it is comfortable. Bakery pies and sweets are baked in restaurant.

The food was great once it finally came after waiting and waiting and waiting.  Then we never got the check and had to wait up front at the counter (and wait some more) until someone showed up there to help.  I don't know how they intend to stay in business if they don't have enough staff to handle five tables to 8:30am....
terrible food and service would never go back ask for fresh fruit and got dark soggy fruit and found a peice of hair and my food ..
Wayyy too pricey for what you get. Food is just okay and portions are small. However, service is quick (even during prime breakfast hours on a Saturday) and waitresses are very friendly.

Late Monday night after the theater went to get a bite. I had the turkey triple club. It was really very good. It came with fries and I got a side salad. The fries were done perfectly and the salad was fresh and plentiful. The portion was so big I I took half the sandwich and fries home. My husband had a side salad, Reuben with onion rings. He let me try his. I wish I had taken a picture  the Reuben was stacked high with meat and the onion rings were done to perfection. Very good. I will get that next time we return!! Our server was very nice and attentive even though he was very busy. I think he was the only wait staff and he did a really good job.  They had the floor cleaner in, understandably this is a 24 hour restaurant. The guy apologized and said they have been cleaning the floors for a long time and never have seen it this busy.  We didn't mind, it was somewhat entertaining. And food and service was good.

We had Lunch there on a Sunday ,pretty busy . I say the food is ok not a wow but ok. The service was good and the place looked pretty clean . They got lots to pick from.  We did wait a long time for are food. The prices are not to bad either . I will give them another try maybe for dinner.

HORRIBLE SERVICE! Conveniently out of lower priced meal so they can up charge!!! RUDELY REFUSED to substitute, and made snarky comment about "other people can afford the upcharge and don't mind paying more"....

Update: After coming here a bunch of times we have still had zero issues. Service is always quick, and servers are very nice. We've had Tony as our server a bunch of times and he's always been great! The supervisor also walks around and helps his servers.

Perkins is a casual restaurant chain that serves American comfort food, including breakfast throughout the day.  I came here in the middle of the night because it was one of the only dining options that was still open at that time. I ordered a fried trio dish and quesadillas. Both were made fairly well considering that this is a franchise. My fried items were really crispy and satisfied my craving of sinfully greasy food. The quesadillas were way too spicy for me but my SO seemed to enjoy them. We took advantage of the half off apps deal and were able to eat for very cheap.   My major complaint is the service and the wait time. We were seated immediately but our food felt like it took ages to come out. Our server was also slow in taking our orders and bringing items we asked for to our table. The restaurant was not busy so maybe this issue can be attributed to understaffing. However, our server seemed to be really absentminded and she had to come back to our table because she forgot our order. We also had to ask her multiple times for items and ended up just borrowing ketchup from another table because the wait for her to come back was too long.

The waitress wasn't very friendly (huge pet peeve of mine) .. She got very annoyed when I asked her to make my omelette with real eggs instead of "liquid".   The food.. Spot on!!!! The breakfast potatoes were spot on and the omelette was cooked perfectly.

A a friend and I went and the hostess when we greeted her we made a funny remark and she turned around and said I hate my job and she had absolutely no finesse she asked us if we wanted a booth or a table we said booth and she said let me go clean one off.  Then she never even walk this over to the booth she said it's right there in the front on the right hand side the food was okay and then when we went to pay the bill she never even asked us how the rest how our experience was if we like the food if there is anything wrong Chad no personality whatsoever and I believe that a Hostess makes or breaks a restaurant maybe she was having a bad day but I won't go back to that Perkins

The food was truly bad specifically the potatoes... they smelled like they've been stored in a sewer. I went home and was sick for 5 hours... truly would not recommend anyone this place.  Had the eggs Benedict which was was actually two sunny side up fried eggs on top of two English muffins... That was truly laughable... they were decent but it was missing some ingredients.  I would recommend the hollandaise sauce on the side... it is awful!  They seem to have a more mature demographic coming to this restaurant... they should strongly consider the quality of their good given that their clientele seem to have various ailments...  Truly concerned on how bad the food was.
Nothing special Its just a big Dennys or Humptys, except you dont want to wash your jeans and the food wont make you feel like some one stimulated you pelvic splanchnic ganglion

Regardless of how busy they are, we always get great service . It's a saturday morning and they are unusually busy but we had the most kind waitress Lauren ! She had no problem substituting our meals for what made us most happy. We will always return !

Well, it is Perkins so the breakfast fair is pretty standard. My boyfriend and I were in town only to catch a flight at the airport since hurricane Sandy cancelled our flight out of Philly. We waited about 10 minutes to be seated. But after that things were fine. I got the pumpkin pancake breakfast which was good. My boyfriend got the southern friend chicken and biscuits with gravy and they were good.

I want to like a place like Perkins, I really do. I like basic comfort foods and after my third crappy visit here I wont be going back.  I had a coupon for Perkins, so my coworker and I decided to go here. We got there early to avoid the lunch rush, and even at 1130 it was pretty busy. My friend ordered a wrap and salad and I had a blt with fries ( I picked the turkey out). They have virtually nothing for vegetarians. I am not 100% vegetarian, but pretty close and was disappointed in the menu and options, no veggie burger to be seen, no veggie dishes, pastas, nada, zip..  We were seated at a booth and the seat was ripped and duct taped.   Our server was Judy ( the supervisor, or so her name tag said). She was so miserable, not rude, just very "over  it".  As I am with servers ( having served many many years ago) I was friendly and easy to deal with...she was devoid of any emotion...it was really quite sad.. I always think that if you dont like your job, then you should something that you like...she clearly didnt seem to like her job.  The food was ok, definitely not bad for "diner style fare". I wouldnt go back though simply because every time I have eaten  there I left feeling bummed out....sorry Perkins but for me its been  three strikes and now you're out. :(
Had granny's country omlet.  Good food,  polite service and a good place to eat breakfast overall.
My picture was taken here. Four stars just for the mini-chimis and the patty melt.
I dident like the country Benedict it had a white sauce and a sausage that was gross but I switched my meal to regular bacon and eggs and it was better! Great service by waiter

From outside, Perkins at night looks like a shining oasis of enchantment. Cozy atmosphere the second you walk in. Seasonal decorations, kitch sculptures, and lovely waitresses add to the comfort. I enjoyed my slice of chocolate caramel silk pie in the quiet late night atmosphere while a sitting lawn deer statue looked dolefully on. Pie filling was delightful and decadent but too sweet to finish.

I stopped in while waiting to pick someone up from the airport. Boy do I wish I would of went somewhere else! The food had me feeling gross the rest of the day! Not good when your wedding is literally 3 days away.  I ordered the Santa Fe Chicken Chipotle, was a HUGE disappointment! First off, the description read "Blackened chicken." I can assure you that is not what was on my plate, my bun was rock solid to the point where I hit it with my fork, no dent was made! I didn't even have the mentioned ranch dressing. As for an attempt to look for the waiter, he was nowhere to be found.   Just an awful experience all together. Never again!
Great breakfast !! Pancake is amazing ! The food come so fast !! Will come back for sure next time in town !

I am giving this restaurant a 1 star based on the manager at the front desk.  We walked in with a big party of approx 15 and the Manager refused to let me walk in because I was holding a medium Tim Hortons Cup.  He centered me out in front of everyone and told me to leave until I threw out the cup.  If everyone had not already parked and ready to be seated we would have left.  I know everyone did not order as much as they normally would have based on this horrible display of customer service. Not sure how Perkins honestly believes they can compete with Tim Hortons coffee and I will never get why walking in a cup is all of the sudden going to deter anyone from drinking their crappy coffee!   Poor business practices, and customer service!  It's obvious we were not there for the just coffee and they just lost 15 customers based on this experience.

I stopped by with some teammates, a while back, after a hockey game.  I got a honey mustard chicken sandwhich thing and horrible food poisoning.  If it weren't for the horrible gastrointestinal distress it would have been about 3 stars.
Service was excellent and food was hot and ready. Well go again if I'm ever in the area. .
Our server Kelly was absolutely awesome the food came out good and hot and if you ever want to go I would really suggest this location

Since I stayed at the Hampton Inn, I decided to grab a quick lunch next door at Perkins. Boy, was this a mistake. Let me explain:  1. This place does not offer vegetarian-friendly lunch options. I ended up getting the tomato basil soup and the wedge salad without the bacon. Both were subpar. 2. The service staff showed little effort. After my waitress carelessly placed the water on my table, she just threw my straw in front of me and hurriedly proceeded to serve the neighboring table. Wow. What's more is that my wedge salad was hastily assembled--the iceberg lettuce was stacked in chunks and the bleu cheese was piled on one side.  3. The booth I sat at was not well-cleaned, and the table was sticky. How the heck this happened is beyond me.  The only thing holding me back from giving them 1 star is that their pastries at the front counter look well made. Sorry, Perkins. You're never seeing me again.
First time here at midnight, ordered some fried chicken strips. Next day I have a severe stomach-ache. Not recommended.

I was concerned when I read some of the other reviews, but this Perkins met all my expectations. The menu is the same one I saw in other Perkins restaurants in Wisconsin. I wish I could remember our server's name so I could give her some recognition. She was both friendly and very professional.  I could tell that this Perkins is not in the best spot to attract customers when we drove there, and it did seem that they carried a skeleton crew. The servers not only waited tables, they also bused them. As I said we were delighted with the service we received. All four of us in my party ordered something different and the food came out quickly, exactly as we ordered, and was served to the right person without the usual "Who ordered what?" that some servers rely on. The food was hot and well prepared.  We found it amusing that they had two male managers standing around doing nothing while the two waitresses worked their butts off. It is to our waitress's credit that her attitude was so good. And no, I don't know anyone who works there and not do I live in Wisconsin.
Had lunch with my daughter. Hadn't been to a Perkins in years. Was really good. Granddaughter was there. The staff was very attentive.

My expectations were not too high going in and overall it was about what I expected. Service was mediocre at best as I had to wait about five minutes just to be acknowleged by someone to get a table.  When I was seated, it was at a dirty table which had to be cleaned. Chair I sat in was sticky, eww. The restaurant was busy (100pm on Saturday), but it still was a bit dirtier and more unorganized than most. Waitress was pleasent enough but did not offer or refill my drink until right when I was about to leave. Actually, the best part was the meal itself. I had grilled chicken over rice with asparagus. The grilled chicken was moist and flavorful, while the aspargus was cooked just right and delicious. The price was also ok. The meal was definitely close to a 3.5/4 while most everything else was a 2 or a 1. Overall, a 2.5 and would try again, just not anytime soon.
The Boys and i went here, and we had really good food, and the service was good, with the exception of the side dishes they totally forget to bring. Its a good place, but its a little slow too.
Just enjoyed an omelette.Highlights were server and  customer service. Kudos to Otto!..
Here again for the second day in a row. I don't care what everyone else says. This place is 5 stars solid for the value and service you get!

Good place to hang out after your evening shift, or bar closings.  Don't bother too much with anything other than breakfast, which is not the greatest, but consistent and filling.  In other words, fill the void and don't expect parsley or anchovies on your ceasar salad.

Gotta love breakfast places.. they make the world go around.  Went in for a typical Canadian breakfast and was pleased to get exactly what I had ordered. Not that greasy from what I can remember as well.    Very clean presentation and fresh ingredients used.    Great place for large groups and families alike.   Service was prompt pricing is average.

I came in tonight to grab some take-out.  I stood at the empty hostess stand and waited...waited....waited....waited.  Finally I see a waitress coming up aaaannnd....she studied the carpet pattern with such attention that she walked by me without a word.  There were about five people scattered around the restaurant eating.  I walked out and bought tomorrow's breakfast at Walgreens, yuuuummmy!

Yes, it's a chain restaurant. Food is consistent. I tend to be able to get here early in the morning when the restaurant is usually empty. At that time, the service is outstanding. Waitress on duty is very friendly.
Clean, friendly establishment. Our host and server were both very friendly and attentive. Food was average but we liked that you get a free slice of pie every Monday with your meal!
Standard family diner. Nothing surprising here. A decent place to stop for breakfast.
Did not have a good experience, table was dirty with cream and sugar wrappers on it ... the waitress did not notice.   Did not find the portions big at all for the price

OK this place is good old American style comfort food! When you want/need to max the carbs out to get your endorphins spinning out of control this is the place to go. Reminds me of an upper scale Dennys - similar food choices but they taste better and overall more comfortable setting. Have been going here since the 80's with family and friends. Being open 24 hours I have visited many times after midnight back in the 90's - fun memories with friends!

I should have known that seeing only one other table occupied at 7am was not a good sign; it wasn't. The coffee was pretty good and the service was decent if not overwhelming. But the breakfast - especially in the context of VALUE - left a lot to be desired. Had it not been for the fact that this place was within easy walking distance of my hotel (drizzling outside), I would have looked elsewhere.  Eleven dollars got me a French toast breakfast. The French toast was OK but that's about it. The fake maple syrup was a turn-off. The eggs were decent, but not great. But the two WIMPY strips of bacon really had me shaking my head. Four bites and gone. There is a Southern-style "Old Country Store" not far away that serves decent bacon and real maple syrup. Had it not been for the greater-than-one-mile walk, I would have gone there.  The piped-in gawdawful 70's & 80's music further added to my irritation.  Were it not for the good coffee and decent service, this place would've gotten ONE star.
Pretty good breakfast. Good service - I didn't wait at all to be seated or to receive my food.  I really like the food came exactly as I ordered it.

A taste for everyone!  Super friendly staff with a menu for all.  They offer breakfast, lunch, and dinner at all times and have a mouth-watering dessert menu!  Portion size is more than expected and the staff are accommodating to any requests.  Great prices and their meals and the service is well worth a higher tip!  I've visited this location a handful of times and have received the same excelled services each time.

I can't stress how disappointing my visit was to this location. In the past I lived in Buffalo and visited the Perkins in Williamsville many times and always got solid food.   Today the server messed up our order so many times that we actually started laughing at each additional error. Each noted error had to be repeated until it was right: the wrong salad was brought out and the next one had the wrong dressing. The server caught that a side was missing then forgot to get it. She kept apologizing and we kept smiling.   A comedy of errors culminating in a meh and cold club sandwich. A lot of factors can lead to distracted workers so we didn't take it personally. However too many errors to go back given the available choices in the area.

I absolutely would not come back here. The food is mediocre at best and definitely not worth the price.   We mulled over the menu for quite a while and finally opted for French toast and a magnificent seven. The pancakes that came with the magnificent seven were tasteless and dry. My first instinct was to add more maple syrup but it wasn't much better. It almost tasted as though it had been watered down. To top it all off, the eggs were undercooked.   The ONLY reason why this is getting more than a 1-star is because the waitresses where really pleasant, quick and efficient.   It's so disappointing to go out for a meal only to end up paying for something I could have made better myself.

Oh. My. God.  One would think that any restaurant in America's Dairyland, especially a chain restaurant that has been around for decades, could serve breakfast without screwing it up.  Our family of three ordered breakfast for dinner tonight and this Perkins disappointed the heck out of us.  One order was steak and eggs: the steak was supposed to be medium and the eggs over hard. What came to the table was a bloody, raw steak -- not rare, mind you, but raw -- and eggs with a translucent, inedible crust around the outer edge.  Some of that crust ended up in one of the other orders, which was scrambled eggs with biscuits and gravy. One does not expect the possibility of breaking a tooth when eating scrambled eggs, but not one, not two, but three two-inch long pieces of that translucent crust ended up in the folded, dry "scrambled eggs."  Another order of scrambled eggs -- mine -- had a long, thin, hair-like thread of indeterminate origin. Was it the same substance as the translucent crust? Was it a string from a hairnet? Was it a human hair? When I pulled it from my mouth, it split in two and curled up like elastic might curl up.  Our server was appropriately apologetic and tried to make things okay -- the service was good, but the food was absolutely horrid!  The manager asked us how our dinner was when we went to pay, so we told her. She took 20% off of our bill but, truly, the food we ate was overpriced at any discount. If we all hadn't been so darn hungry and tired, we'd have left without eating. And if I had it to do over, I would have insisted we all leave after finding the inedible translucent hard gluey stuff in the eggs and find somewhere else to go.  Do NOT repeat our mistake. AVOID this restaurant. Try the IHOP down the road if you want breakfast. Go across the interstate to Texas Roadhouse if you want a steak. Go hungry if you must, just don't eat here. Please.

Came here on a Sunday because the other breakfast options had long waits.  We were seated immediately here, which was nice, because we had a time frame to work in.  Server was friendly, and the food was surprisingly decent.  Comparable to Bob Evans in terms of quality, but maybe a smidge better service.

My wife went here with her church group and liked it, so she suggested I go with her sometime. We went on a Wednesday and I have to say I was impressed. Waitress was nice and attentive, yet not too. Wednesday we found out was senior's night with a discount. We both had the Chicken Tenders, and it was wonderful. I had buttered corn along with a side salad, my wife had Mashed potatoes and broccoli. She loved it all. Neither of us are big eaters so there was enough left to take home for lunch the next day.
Went with a healthy option, spinach & mushroom scramble. One of the better healthy options I have had anywhere. Service and atmosphere were great. Had a very pleasant experience.
Food was great and came out quick. The smasher was very cheesy. Service was friendly and pretty good coffee also.

Food was really bad. Fried pickle badder was salty make the dish overly salty because pickles are already salty, the bajou shrimp smasher was bad. They didn't scramble the eggs very well. It looked and tasted like they put eggs in a skillet and then when it was done cut it up and called it scramble. The shrimp was over cooked and the onions and bell pepper wasn't sauteed for enough time,so it was really crunchy. With all that being said the staff was more then willing to refund my money and apologized for the bad experience.

I can't comment on food as the service was so bad I had to walk out with the family. It went a little like this. On a weekday morning the family decides to have breakfast at Perkins. We came as a party of 6 but sat in a booth for 4. As we sat there discussing amongst ourselves on seat location the server comes out puts in the middle of the table 4 napkins and counts out 6 forks, 6 knives, and 6 spoons. At this time you may think whats the matter with that. As I look around the restaurant everybody else had individually wrapped silverware while ours was counted out in big mess in the middle of the table. I took the silverware problem as a grain of salt and waited to place our drink orders.   After a 20min of waiting to place a drink order we already knew what we wanted to eat.  Server finally comes over and asks us what we like to drink. Everybody went around the table and place their respective drink orders. After the last person put in their order, I informed her we are ready to order. Server informs me that she will come back with our drinks then take our orders, which seem like no problem. That was until it took 10 min just for our drinks to come out. After drinks were passed out I attempted to order and was again placed on hold. Server needed to get another tables order that was ready. By this time my patients was very thin. We've been there for over 40 min and was only served drinks and have not placed an order.  After the server served her table of food, another table across from her asked for refills. When she left to fill there cups, we decided to leave. If taking an order was this bad, how long would it take for the food to come out? So we decided to leave.
