Everything tasted terrible like it was all cooked in the same grease from yesterday. Waitresses were on point but that's the only good thing. We left( a family of 6) with only like 8 bites taken a piece. Never again will I subject myself to something so gross again.

I just got an email saying this location is closed.  Is it? I like Perkins and the variety in the menu.  My son, grandson, and I like different things so that works for us.  Likewise for the bakery case, lots of variety.

OK, best service ever! At 10 pm on a Sunday with nothing else to eat besides Taco Bell, it was nice to sit down and be taken care of.  Cheap and easy, just how I like it.  It's Perkins...you get what you pay for, but we had great service in Ohio, so there!

Staff is very friendly, other than that, they really need to CLEAN. It smells like mildew/musty, in the whole place. floors/old carpet are visibly dirty. The bathrooms are dirty as well, no TP. Portions are small and not well cooked, definitely not worth the price - for breakfast anyway.  Too bad, it used to be a good place to go for breakfast.

Just like the Perkins in the states with excellent service to match! Yummy all-day breakfast, hot and fresh coffee, and service with a smile. I was treated to a meal here with my daughter, and we will both be returning. (We didn't get a chance to try any desserts yet!) Great job so far!

I haven't been to a Perkins for a long time, but decided to stop in for breakfast.  The menu offers a number of items.  Service was attentive.  I ordered an omelet and unfortunately was disappointed.  When I order an omelet, I am used to having ingredients mixed in with the omelet and having it look and taste fresh.  What i received looked like an egg patty wrapped around ingredients.  The cheese was not even melted but a square piece was laid on top of the rolled omelet. I have seen frozen omelets that were more inspired.

They accommodated our party of 11 quite quickly which was pretty impressive seeing as there were a lot of other parties waiting for tables. Their menu is similar to a Denny's or an IHOP. I was a little disappointed that they didn't have corned beef hash (my go to food item at breakfast places) but there were lots of other menu items that caught my eye. I ended up getting their classic eggs breakfast which came with two eggs, hash browns, a fresh in house baked muffin, and bacon. Everything was great except one of my poached eggs turned out to be hard boiled.  P.S. if you like your hash brows crispy you should ask for them that way. Theirs are on the softer side.

The Perkins here has never been known for being staffed with happy people.  I found that they continue the tradition with my recent visit for lunch. Now I was looking forward to seeing the new place as they really needed a refresher and a clean up.   The new place helps but I'm not so sure I like the layout.  It is small and boxy.  I liked the old layout better.   But the place is brighter which is nice. The food was pretty good so no fault there.  But the service was subpar.   I felt like they could care less if I ate there or not.   We joked around a little with our waitress and she barely cracked a smile.   The manager came by and asked us if everything was ok and when we said it was she stated that she was glad to hear that in a sort of canned way while she was walking away.  Once again giving us the impression that she could care less. Now we saw our waitress at another point away from our table and think that she was stressed out over something.  So whatever it was was showing up in her attentiveness to her customers.  We still gave her a good tip because she looked like she needed it. Bottom line is I won't be going back here for some time until the management and staff change over which I suspect it will in about 6 months.  See you then. 2017 Hard to believe it has been 4 years since I have eaten here!  See what happens when someone has a bad experience? I returned to meet up with three friends.  This time went quite well.   The food good as reported by my friends and I have to say that my Cobb Salad was excellent.  If you like salad they do this salad up nice and it is a very good size.  No skimping here. The staff was better in that they were pleasant but no one was there to greet us when we arrived and we had to wait a while.   The place was not busy, only about three other tables had people at them.   The bakery section has been reduced quite a bit so it doesn't seem like Perkins is the bakery place it once was.  I got two brownies to go and they were very good. So they go up a notch but need to improve on their cheerfulness.  Overall very good service at our table.

A bizarre experience. Our waitress was irritated to have to wait on us from the moment we sat down. We visited at a semi-busy time but they weren't slammed so no excuse for the saltiness from the waitress. She forgot items and cut me off mid sentence multiple times. Another waitress picked up her slack somewhere in the middle of our meal and was attentive and seemed happy to be doing her job.   The food was ok. I wouldn't recommend anything that isn't deep fried though. I was really disappointed with this location as I had great experiences at other Perkins in the past. I would not go back to this location and would not recommend it.

I ordered the Belgian waffle with strawberries at 1230am.  It was me and two groups of 4 people. Service seemed a bit slow for the small crowd of customers. Food was ok. The manager was a bit pushy. I enjoyed free WiFi.

No stars** This place is gross, dark and I'd never eat there. I went inside once, last year. I didn't even want to sit but I figured I would give it a shot. The place just looked dark and gloomy so when we got to the table it was sticky and there is a odor in the place. No way I could eat food there. I can't wait for the good Perkins in Brooklyn to reopen!

I went here recently, and I had a spinach and cheese omelet.  A strange thing happened in the kitchen though, something kind of like the fog that turns you inside out, I suspect.  When my omelet came out it was actually a spinach omelet with a bit of egg and cheese tucked inside.  Wow, that is so crazy........oh and gross.  I am not Popeye, nor am I a rabbit, therefore playing a game of find the egg and cheese in a spinach haystack is not awesome dudes.  FAIL.

My wife introduced me to Perkins just this year and every time we've driven through  Wisconsin, we've stopped at a Perkins. This was the 3rd Perkins that I've been to and have enjoyed the food and service every time.  We both ordered pancakes with a side of bacon. The food was very good and the service was even better.  My wife commented that either Perkins manages to hire the friendliest people or they have excellent training.

One of the best chain breakfast restaurants in Calgary.   Pricing is awesome, huge huge menu and service is always excellent.   Portions and taste of food is very good.   Interior dining area and seats feels dated but it is a breakfast place!  Overall great restaurant to go for anytime breakfast. Great value.

This is quietly the worst food I have ever been served.  My family of four visited this place and neither one of us could eat our food.  Between the four of us, we had the steak medallion, the maple glazed pork chops, the granny omelet and the big country skillet.  None of us could eat more than three bites of our food.  The food here is simply not seasoned.   None of the food had a taste.  They took a piece of meat and cooked it without any tips of seasoning, not even salt and pepper.  We couldn't even eat the pancakes because they had no taste either.  The best thing here was the coke soft drinks.  Do yourself a favor and find another place to eat!

Not too shabby.  Easily one of the cleanest Perkins I've ever seen.  I was told this location was recently renovated.  You have to register you license plate at the front counter, as they share the parking lot with a Holiday Inn and it is very close to the airport.  We got a nice booth fairly close to the window.    Anyhow, the service was very good.  The server was quite efficient and we never felt rushed at any point.  I had the "Farmer's Omelette" with breakfast potatoes & 3 buttermilk pancakes.  The pancakes were light and fluffy....not the best I've ever had but much better than Denny's or The Golden Griddle.  The omelette was also very good.  They have an interesting way of folding the omelettes.  I didn't have room for the breakfast potatoes....so I took them home with me and made a (mostly) homemade scrambler the next day.   In our group of 4 everyone ordered breakfast items and were happy with both their meals and the service.  Nice job.
Service was fine, restaurant was clean. Pancakes had zero flavor. Sausage links were WHITE inside. Like globs of fat with no meat.
Michael greeted us warmly at the door. He was also our waiter, his service was prompt and very friendly. The food was served quickly and very good!
I loved the chicken with mushroom and asparagus.My boyfriend loved the turkey meatloaf.We had Apple pie and it was very good.Would definitely comeback.
The restaurant is clean with big parking spot. My only complaint here is the tables. It's very tight especially if there's more than two people. Otherwise food is awesome and service was swift.

I only come for breakfast..and that occurs before 6 am. The place has a large number of older men who frequent the place and the wait staff are super good at their jobs. The management is a little creepy. Food is standard fare.

Friends said too try this for breakfast and I'm glad I did! 730 on a Monday morning it was pretty empty, so we were confident we would get great service. We did. Food was good portions were big and waitress was great. More expensive than Denny's but worth it.

I used to visit Florida frequently and Perkins was one of our go-to places in the neighbourhood where I usually stayed. Seeing one open up in Pickering close to home brought back some memories, good memories, although not of their food. It was good for its time.  I remember Perkins being good for breakfast and brunch so I came here with breakfast in mind and ended up with a popular brunch item - Steak Medallions and Eggs, served with hash browns and a side of three buttermilk pancakes. Coffee was extra.  Nobody should ever complain about portions at this place. It was a lot of food! I had ordered my steak cooked to medium and it was very tender but was much closer to medium rare. Not a big deal for me. The eggs were cooked fine but the hash browns could have used a little more colour. Not a bad dish though.  The pancakes were served on a separate plate, topped with a pat of butter and accompanied by three different syrups in a caddy. This alone would have been enough breakfast for several people that I know.  Servicewise, it was nice to see the manager checking up on tables throughout the dining room. My server, however, was trying just a little too hard. There's often a fine line between good and annoying service. This was much closer to the latter. She kept telling me her name and suggested several times that I give her a good rating for her service (for their online survey and otherwise). Sorry, this was a fail.  Overall, the food was good and I'll be back. I've seen several restaurants fail in this location so I hope they do well. I wish they opened later.

It's not fine dining, but I've always enjoyed eating at a Perkins. They serve decent affordable comfort food. I've always received good friendly service and here was no different. The restaurant was just across the street from my hotel so it was pretty convenient for me. The entrance was sort of in the back.  For this particular visit, I ordered the turkey dinner with mashed potatoes and corn. It was good as if it was an early Thanksgiving dinner. I had an ice tea with my meal and my server made sure to keep my glass full the entire time.

Perkins is not our typical stop... however my boyfriend has been begging me for months for Perkins potato pancakes and tonight I gave in... I'm so happy I did. Our server Judy was hands down the best server we have ever had! She has been with the company since I believe she said 1987 which would explain the incredible service!  Thanks Judy!
Ugh is about all you can say about this Perkins location. Poor service that results in incorrect orders.  Food that's tasteless or under/overdone. Find a better option.

This has been a go-to spot for brunch for my family for years and years. It was also a great spot for us as teenagers when we wanted a late meal after hanging out. But this review is based on more recent visits. :-)  It can get busy on Sundays after churches typically get out. But, for the most part, there is not a long wait. One one recent occasion I had brunch with my mom and a family friend. I ordered a salad. It was HUGE. I actually had to take half of it to go! On the second recent trip, we went out as a family for Mother's Day. No wait late in the afternoon. I ordered the banana blueberry pancakes. They were supposed to be multigrain, but learned that they had discontinued the multigrain batter the week before. :-(  But the waitress said that they could make them with regular batter. I was surprosed that the bananas were not baked in the pancake, rather they were sliced on top. Regardless, the pancakes were still good. They have sugar free syrup if that is your preference and it wasn't bad. They let me alter my order no problem. It was supposed to come with turkey sausage and egg whites. But I changed it to fruit and bacon. No extra charge.  Speed of service and attentiveness dependent upon who you get and the time of day. But I haven't had a negative experience. Pay your tab at the front register, not at the table.

I don't usually have much good to say about chain restaurants in CU. But I feel some positive feedback is warranted in this case. Perkins has really upped there game over the past year or so. Though I occasionally have lunch or a late evening snack here, the majority of my experience is during breakfast hours. The food is slightly better than average, better than most chains. But the service, once sorely lacking has improved greatly. Management and staff have improved in attitude, efficiency and speed of service. There are a limited number of good breakfast places in this town and sometimes waits can be long. I believe Perkins provides a worthwhile alternative.

I finally made my first visit to a Perkins and I was very pleasantly surprised.   While I normally like to opt for local restaurants. Perkins is the opposite, being a well established diner chain, like unto IHOP or Denny's.   I would say the biggest departures from Perkin's counterparts were, tables that were not sticky, good service, and the ability to make substitutions without upcharges.  This place is a solid, perfectly adequate, 3 star joint. I would totally come back.
They just don't know how to talk to these people, service is absolutely horrible. Food is not great, but also expensive. They're rude and avoid the cashier, not sure what's up with him.
Chicken fingers with mashed potato, and corn was awesome.  It was clean inside, friendly waitress, stayed at hampton inn next door.   They give you 10% off for saying there.

Out of all the chain breakfast places, I probably will always pick Perkins. Mostly because they have a large variety of choices and their pies.   If you join their Perkins Club, you get a free breakfast meal for your birthday. You always get to know what the Wednesday special is. Secret's Put: buy one get one entree.   Good for families and kid friendly. They also offer Late Night Bites. Every night after 9pm, you can get all you can eat pancakes for $5.99, burger, fries and coke combo for $8.99, and 1/2 price appetizers (not a lot of options in this category) and 1/2 off slices of pie.   I typically stick to their breakfast options. I love their breakfast potatoes. Eggs are always cooked to order. Their pancakes are great. Coffee is decent. Pies are good. I've had their chicken pot pie but it was very salty. However the crust was great.   The manager on duty always walks by tables and also helps out when it gets busier. This is one of the reasons I like coming here when I don't want to cook at home.

Here's a tip:  If you plan on using a coupon at this place, get ready to be treated like garbage. Sat down for breakfast with my mom this morning and she pulled out a coupon book she had bought from a school drive and had nothing but opposition trying to use them from our giddy, passive aggressive server. After that, we were treated to shady glances from the manager and server for the rest of our visit and the most plastic artificial service I have ever had from a server.   Food was good, prices are good, but service was really unprofessional and when I spoke to the manager after our meal he pretended nothing had happened and really did nothing at all to make either of us feel any better.   My parents love eating here, but I am never going back. Plenty of great choices for food of this quality elsewhere without the questionable people skills.

I don't think I've ever had worse service. My girlfriend, roommate and I walked right in and were sat immediately. After sitting for almost 10+ minutes the manager came over to inform us that drinks were on the house and asked if we'd like some. 10+ minutes later our three coffees and one coke arrived minus the coke we ordered. 15+ minutes later food and aforementioned coke was delivered. Waitress (Latasha) forgot to ask what flavor muffin my girlfriend wanted and then did, delivered the muffin and latasha told us it was a,"fake muffin" because they didn't bake it properly. When all was said and done I think I can honestly say I'll never go to Perkins again. Ever.

Waitress was nice. Everything seemed clean but the floor(carpet was littered.) It seemed as if it were shift change time or something because the employees were asking one another if they wanted a table and so on. After it was decided who would take our table we showed the waitress our comp tickets from the previous Perkins experience(see my review on the Brooklyn location) and she promptly took them to the manager for approval. After approval and some ten minutes we ordered 2 waters and 2 coffees. Got 2 coffees and one water then we ordered food. 20 mins and food was ready. While they were readying our food we watched the waitress reach in the bakery case and bare hand my girlfriends muffin from the top. Food came and we tore the muffin open and low and behold a hair was in it(see picture.) I didn't say a word of this to anyone there because this was our second try and... What's the point? The manager who comped our meals also had a shirt on that was completely filthy. Perkins, we tried again. From the cash register you could see into the "expo" area... Also filthy. The pies in the bakery case were propped up by portion cups. I'm sorry but I'm not sold. We won't be back.

I've been coming to this Perkins since I was a kid (popcorn chicken and Where's Waldo? activity books FTW) and while my last visit was not so great, they're generally a reliable location. Most days the food is tasty if unimaginative, they can accommodate groups, and they usually can get you in and out pretty quick despite the lobby being packed to the gills on weekend mornings.   For the last few years I've avoided Perkins on the whole because of sub-par food and service from another location (an annual stop after a camping music festival due to their being open on holidays and ability to seat 10-12 of us with no reservation), but my man friend really likes their breakfast and, more specifically, not having to wait for breakfast like you do at most places downtown. Over the summer I had an avocado/queso/english muffin creation that actually really surprised me with how good it was and breakfast potatoes that were clearly deep fried but similarly surprising in how much I enjoyed them. The breakfast combo price was right ($8ish dollars), and for some reason one of the available sides was a muffin, so I came away with breakfast the next day, too.   Fast forward to a couple weeks ago when we stopped back in. Sadly, my breakfast find had disappeared from the menu and they appear to have done away with the bonkers muffin side. Nothing was really striking my fancy on the most recent menu, so I decided to pick one of the most ridiculous offerings, an apple cinnamon muffin that was sliced into thirds and turned into french toast. I'm sure it was terrible for me, and while the flavor was surprisingly good, muffins just aren't stable enough to hold up to being battered and so it was kind of mushy mess. Compounding my meh meal was the fact that it took close to 40 minutes for our food to arrive, tracking down our server was difficult, and my appetite was put off by how dirty the ledge under our booth was. We were seated in one of their tiny (but cool) two-person booths along the window and with the morning sun pouring in I could see all the crumbs, bits of paper, and rusty bobby pins on the window sill. If anyone from Perkins happens to read this, please, please clean that up. The fact that the pins were rusty tells me it's been awhile since a vacuum has made its way to that area. Yuck.   While my most recent visit was definitely a two-star experience, they've been just fine on other visits so I'll leave my overall rating at a three. Not the best choice in Madison, but a reliable stand-byÂ on the whole.

When you need a late night weeknight dinner, you can count on Perkins to be open. The BF and I went to a later moving screening without having had dinner so we were both hungry after 10. He has a lifelong love of Perkins, so off we went.   There were a surprising amount of people filling the dining room for a late weeknight, but that worked in our favor as they were appropriately staffed and service was fairly quick. While they have late night specials like half-priced slices of pie and AYCE pancakes, I went with the sandwich I had always ordered in high school: the chicken tenders melt.   I don't even want to think about how bad it is for you, but in the moment it hit the spot/scratched that nostalgic itch. At least until I got to a tender that was half connective tissue, anyway. This is par for the course at many chains; no one takes the time to clean the chicken properly, be it in house or at the factory where it's mass-produced. I don't know which is the culprit at Perkins, but I learned years ago to proceed with caution.   I'm probably never going to suggest Perkins as our destination, but since my gent enjoys it I'm sure we'll be back here and there.

I was acknowledged upon entering the restaurant.  The food was amazing!  I had chicken breast with spinach and grilled asparagus.  Randi was my server.  She was very personable, friendly, professional and very prompt.  The manager was on the floor checking with customers on the food and service which was nice.  Mondays, you get free pie included with your meal.  The French silk was delicious.  I will definitely visit again when I'm in the area.

Came here after a cold night after my friends made me go skating with them which was an absolute fail. Then, Everyone was craving breakfast at 9:30pm.   So my friend recommended this place, he said it was kinda like Denny's but not really. So we came here and everyone ordered the breakfast with eggs, sausage, bacon, hashbrowns with a side order of pancakes. I was tempted But ended up getting the burger meal instead with fries, just to be different. It was alright, the breakfast tasted better! Especially those pancakes with whipped butter, Damn I felt like i was 8 years old on a Saturday morning while watching cartoons!    The service was alright, the people are nice but not too nice. Nice cute Denny's look alike place.

pathetic place  but is to be expected at a chain restaurant in the middle of the night.  there was a dead bug in my water.  the workers there are a bunch of high school dropouts.  I even overheard one waiter say the chef is a pothead.  at the end I requested a sugar cookie with the frosting on top.  I get back to my hotel room and discover it had no frosting.  on top of it all, they refused to give me some compensation for all the trouble.  they charged me for an extra bread roll.  the interior of the place looks nice, it's sad that it's being overrun by a bunch of employees that look like they just got out of jail.

Service good, people extremely nice, , food is ok.  The menu options are extremely limited; about 1/3 of the choices you would have at Denny's or IHOP.  The portions are generous, and are served in a timely fashion.  If you are on a diet and want to lose weight, go to their restrooms before you order.  Your appetite is guaranteed to disappear; the stink is painfully evident even in the hall outside the restrooms, and is absolutely disgusting.   Probably won't return.  Hope they expand their menu, and clean the restrooms.

On the road back from Chicago we pulled off the highway for a place to eat.  Not a lot of options so we ventured into Perkins.  Basic food - not very exciting especially after the places we dined in while in Chicago.  Well it looks like vacation is over.
Says they are open 24hrs on their website, but I went there at 11:54 pm and the two waitresses smoking outside told me they were closed. Guess not.

Good tasting inexpensive food. Friendly staff. I had the steak and pepper dish and finished with a slice of cherry pie. Wife had the turkey,BLT club. Both meals were very tasty and I think you get your moneys worth. We also got the buy 3 get 6 muffins for next mornings breakfast.

Alright so I've only ever been here when I've been hungover. But let me tell you, the shitty $1.99 bottomless coffee, hash browns, and omelet stuffed with all sorts of processed cheese and meat...IS THE BEST HANGOVER CURE EVER.    The place is like Denny's.  Big whoop.  Everyone there seems a little depressed....customers, staff, everyone.  But hey, with that type of environment going in your sweatpants and with a hangover...you fit right in.

Getting my free magnificent seven breakfast for free ,I've been coming here on and off since the mid eighties and it's never changed except for getting super expensive like $9.99 for sausage and biscuits.

Love the menu. Staffing is poor. Wife and I went in at 10:00am for breakfast. Lobby had 12 people (6 were checking out,1 person being cashier/hostess.) That left 6 to be seated. The manager told to hostess to "block doors". I asked and they told the patrons waiting it would be a 20 min. wait. Keep in mind that had about 10-15 EMPTY TABLES. This place NEVER HAS ENOUGH STAFF. Food good STAFFING HORRIBLE.
Whenever it's late, or you just hungry for basic food - this is the place for you.  Nothing sophisticated. Nothing special.  Just basic food with very reasonable price

I just love Perkins. Sorry guys - it reminds me of home. In MN we have a target and a perkins on every corner, here it's walgreens and george webbs. I miss home.   Before heading to Camp Randall for the game I stopped in at Perkins for some breakfast. I was seated right away and Diane came over to grab a drink order. She was attentive and helpful, our food came out quickly, and checkout was smooth. I would come back, if for nothing else, the chicken noodle soup (:

Just left awesome service..the steak medallions w hollandaise sauce were tender and juicy and just fabulous..the fresh fruit was cold and juicy the muffin was soft moist and just wonderful.Best breakfast on town..Manager Corin.was sweet smiling and a great way to start our day ...Five star meal. WOW.

If you crave 3000 calories of breakfast food for less than $10 late at night after a couple of hours of skiing (or anything else), your only options on the west side are Denny's, IHOP, and Perkins.  I guess I'm discounting McDonalds, but I don't count that as real food even though these other three skirt the line at times (I doubt there is anything approximating "real" in their pancake syrup).  Of the three, Perkins is probably the best, but the others get the job done as well.    Warning-- Friday night is all you can eat fish fry until 9.  At 11 pm it was still clear from the tater tots that they had cooked a lot of fish that night, and hadn't changed the oil.  Lucky for me, they were my kid's tater tots...
After ihop shut down on campus, Perkins is an alternative for brunch. I ve never been here for lunch and dinner so far.

The service here is unbelievably bad. Waited 10 minutes just to be seated and now we have waited for almost an hour for our food. There is literally one waitress and no hostess.  Turns out there's also no cook. He cut his finger so the hostess/manager who isn't a cook is cooking. The good news is our meal was comped because when it did come it was vile. How can you screw up grilled cheese and pancakes.  Never again. Free or not.

Watch closely when you Pay.  They swipe our card (they don't have the chip equipment yet) 3 times.  I check my Bank and sure enough, I was double billed.   It is a real hassle to get the money put back into my account.  And I have to show them my Bank statement,  which is on my phone.  I don't like it.  But to get $30.00 to $45.00 back I have no other choice.    Oh and one more thing,  Snarky with a capital S.  Never hardly a Manager on duty.  And WHY is it so hard to say you're welcome instead of No Problem when I say Thank you?   A real peeve of mine.   I'll be nice and give one star.  This is the Perkins in Urbana,  IL.

I stopped in looking to grab an early 5:30 AM breakfast. I walked in and noticed one male and one female employee joking around with each other. Wouldn't matter at all if it weren't for the following... My first stop was the men's restroom. I didn't need to use the restroom, but I did need to blow my nose. I opened the sole stall door. There was blood splattered on the floor and against the lower wall a bit. You're probably as perplexed as I was. The toilet was extremely disgusting.  Definitely needed flushed, but also cleaned. One of the worst restrooms I've seen in a long time. No way was I going to eat any food from that place. I turned around and walked out without even blowing my nose. I went across the street to Dunkin' Donuts. So while I can't rate the food, the place really didn't give me a chance to.

I'm good with the Perkins. My daughter is a fan of chocolate chip pancakes, and that's what she wanted and got. My eggs benedict was reasonably chain-store decent, and my other daughter enjoyed her meal also.  We got seated pretty quickly on a Sunday morning, and we left satisfied for the cost.

We were greeted when we came in and seated right away. Took waitress 10 minutes to come see us and they were not very busy.  We ordered our food which came pretty quick. I tried the new shrimp and pasta thing they have it was priced at $11.00 it was the smallest thing j have ever seen a Jenny Craig meal was bigger than this have in mind also there was no additional lauded or a salad that came with it so I left starving. Wife had the chicken fried steak huge plate with mashed potatoes and beans or tots for way less than fine what a rip off for me. The the waitress was like never there I ate my whole meal and never saw her once to get a drink refill. I would never go back there you get better service at Denny's

I've come here on 3 occassions. All of them were because I was hungry and nothing else was open. Did what I had to do to survive.   The food isn't necessarily bad but it's not good either. It's very much ... it's hard to describe. Let me back up.  I've dined here during the late night hours around midnight. You would think it would be slow considering the time but that is far from the case. Again, due to other sit down places being  closed at midnight, Perkin generates business for this reason alone. They serve typical diner food, breakfast, finger food, burgers, soups, etc. There are usually 2 servers working the entire diner. Services while good is very slow because waiters are working hard to be at more than one place at one time which is impossible. I give them credit for being as good as they are for that. Also, kudos to them for being professional. I've seen some extremely rude diners and they kept their composure.   Food again isn't bad but it's your typical late night diner food. It serves it purpose for filling you up but it's nothing that is the finest quality. They are better known for their bakery. Once, I had a muffin and was pleasantly surprised with how good it was. Their pies and other pastries really do look appetizing I must admit and to be diner made, they are good.   Overall, Perkins serves it purpose. To be a diner that stays open 24 hours and feeds people decent food.

Great place to eat after church and for breakfast is amazing. There are so many choices like omelets, pancakes, breakfast burrito, and more. There's this one waiter that is so funny. The bakery is good because you could just walk to the cashier and pick what you want and the pies are delicious.
very  over priced  got pancakes bacon  drink  and  my  friend  got  small  breckfest  price  was  30.00 before  tip  35.00 after

Absolutely horrible food, stale and terrible service. Waited for over half an hour to just get coffee.  So called Manager on duty was a really winner! Obviously has never had any public customer service experience. Going to report to head office. Don't waste your time or $$ at this dump.

This restaurant was bad from the start. There was a distinct stench as soon as we walked in the door and got worse as we entered the dining room. It really made it tough to even eat my meal.  The silverware was not very clean and my glass of water was sticky on the outside.  Our waitress was super nice, that was about the only bright spot.  The food was not very good in my opinion, but the rest of my family said they enjoyed their meals.   I would not choose to eat here given almost any alternative.
Very homely atmosphere....good breakfast menu...kind of place where u'd want 2 go with ur family for a sunday brunch

This is a place that is fun to go to if you just left the bars and have the munchies.  The food is okay.. oily.. not that great tasting either.  The employees seem a little disgruntled.  I have seen people bring work here and eat.  I don't actually understand why.  It needs to be a lot brighter for me to come here.

I had breakfast this morning at Perkins Restaurant & Bakery.  It apparently opened at 6am but when I got there about 6:45am, there were no servers or hosts in sight.  The sign at the door said to wait to be seated ... so I did ... then I finally sat myself.  There was another fella waiting to be seated ahead of me (he waited) and we were the only two in the restaurant for a while so it's not like the servers were busy taking care of others.  I built my own breakfast and had a couple fried eggs, toast, bacon and homestyle potatoes.  It was a good breakfast.   When I was finished, no one gave me my bill so I went to the cash to pay.  A couple servers were there talking about one's dog that attacked another dog recently and was going to get sued.  They kept talking while ringing my bill in.  It was like I wasn't even there.  I would think that good customer service would mean they would pause their conversation while taking care of me and then carry on once I've left.  The restaurant is attached to the Holiday Inn so you have to take a parking ticket to get in but the restaurant validates the ticket so parking is free for two hours.
Good old American style breakfast near the airport. Great value so if you have time eat here before you head to your flight.

We love their wonderful wednesdays because of our favorite server and their food is pretty darn good. Their garden side salads are always fresh and very appetizing and we like their grilled tilapia and shrimp dinner, and their salmon and pasta dinners. The kitchen does a nice job presenting an appealing and tasty meal. It's always a pleasure to dine here for a casual dinner out!

For a Perkins its a decent place. quick service. Open 24/7 which is always helpful. Several hotels near by so if you get in late and need a bite to eat this is your place. You can walk from many of the hotels to this location.

I have been here a few times, and haven't had a bad experience yet. The waiters/waitresses have all been friendly and helpful. I enjoy their breakfast specials way more than their other menu items. Every time I have ordered their breakfasts, they have been spot on and exactly what I order. Their other menu items (sandwiches/burgers) have been mediocre, and I have had to pick out rotten pieces of lettuce from the salad.  Definitely recommend this place if you craving eggs, hashbrowns and sausage/ham/bacon.

3.1415.....pie pie pie!!! Who cannot love a nice slice of pie. After a delicious dinner my friend suggested to come to this place to order pie. He mentioned that they make them fresh every day with a wide selection. The restaurant certainly didn't disappoint, there were 8 different types. I ordered the caramel Apple pie to go. Not to mention they are a breakfast and brunch restaurant. My friend has been here for brunch and only had great things to say about it. So if you're ever in Pickering come here for breakfast and don't miss the pie

Oh Perkins them Perkins... I really can't understand how did I make it there - probably because all the restaurants around were already discovered, and it was close to the Royal Inn where we were usually renting the cars.  There is nothing really wrong with Perkins - it is just a place where kids are bored to death by their grandmas sitting around, chatting about something very important. If I was a kid, I would beware of my parents intention to visit Perkins, and hide under the bed.  Family place, family food. Good for veggie folks, because seems like even "meat" there is made of soy, and all the rest - of recycled carton.  Very strict and sloooow moving old ladies roleplaying servers, and looking like their client grandmas - but without the kids under control.  For the price I've paid, I was not even annoyed that much about a small, funny portion of something ultra-light, and just drove downtown to get some real food.

We often end up at Perkins late at night when we are craving pancakes. :) You can count on this location for fast friendly service. My favorite item is the chocolate chocolate chip muffin. The soup is not half bad. I guess it is basically what you would expect from a chain like this. What makes this location stand out is the good service and cleanliness.

This place has pretty good food, especially for late at night. They have a $5.99 AYCE pancake option, and half off all appetizers at night. Prices are pretty competitive. Even their cheaper entree options (eggs in a hole) are moderately filling.   Service wasn't superb, but not shoddy either. Definitely come here to take advantage of the prices.

It is what it is. Friendly employees. Server was okay.  It much to say here. Went in for hangover food in a hurry. I got the heart mans breakfast. My food was okay. My friends on the other hand... did not look appealing. She got a build your own breakfast. Eggs and pancakes were okay I guess. The breakfast potatoes she got looked fake. But what can you say with a corporate store on a budget? The lemon in my water was old. I work in restaurant industry. I know what they look like. Crippled and slimy. Server was good with getting what we needed. She was quick and to the point though. I was hungover..... so yeah it wasn't horrible. I got fueled up lol

I've eaten here twice now, and neither time was particularly enjoyable.  The food itself is fine; exactly what you'd expect from a Perkins.  I tried one of their newer omelets, and it was surprisingly tasty.  I had that problem where I was too full to eat more but wanted to keep eating...  The service, however, leaves much to be desired.  The first time I went was on a Sunday around noon, so it was pretty busy.  My boyfriend and I stood in front of the podium waiting for someone to come to put our names on the list.  When someone finally came, he first took the name of someone who had come in after us, like we weren't even there.  It took a while to be seated, but that's understandable since it was about time for Sunday brunch.  The second time was again on a Sunday around noon, but it wasn't near as busy.  Our waitress took our orders promptly, but afterwards, the quality of service plummeted.  My water glass was empty for at least 15 minutes before getting a refill, twice.  The waitress had walked past our table many times, but didn't even look at us to see how we were doing.  Our food took forever to come, and I understand there were five of us so that can take a while, but this was ridiculous.  And the waitress didn't say a thing the whole time.  When the food did come, it was warm, so at least the meal itself was good.  I asked for a box, but it never came.  I ended up asking for one at the counter myself to avoid waiting probably another half hour.  Overall, our waitress stopped at our table maybe five times total, and never apologized for the long wait or even noticed that we were pretty upset with our service.  In addition, several of the other employees were arguing loudly in earshot of customers, which I think is pretty unprofessional.  I can't say I'd recommend going here, and if you do, expect to wait.

An interesting bit: when you first walk in, you're asked to sign in with your license plate number if you're not staying at the adjacent Holiday Inn. A bit odd, but we were borrowing a car, and got to know the license number real fast 'cause we ate here several times!  The food is delicious. The usual Perkins fare. The need to have a soothing, hot meal is inversely proportional to the temperature outside. It's the digestive equivalent of a warm bath. Especially when they honor special requests. Some of the best customer service I've seen in a long time.   My only complaint would be that at least twice, bits of egg shell were mixed in with the eggs. That was distracting and not good. I didn't send it back because I was so hungry, I just tried to work around it. There were so many, you'd think they did it on purpose so we'd get more calcium, or something. No thanks! I do that to my gardens, but it's not for me. Also, it's not really a complaint but an observation: no veggie burgers. Kinda weird. I think they'd sell a lot of them if they had them.  The orders were always delivered correctly; the service was courteous, and they had lots of patience for weary travelers. We usually went as the two of us, but our last visit included five, and they still did a fantastic job. We had to leave before I finished my coffee, and a kind waitress (not even the one working our table) took notice and brought me a fresh coffee in a to-go cup! Fabulous! Bless her heart!  We'd definitely go back when in the area.

Waitress gives you wrong food then says you ordered wrong. Cool. Thanks Perkins for the horrible over priced meal I didn't order. I got some weird dish with hash browns in my pancakes and scrambled eggs. I despise scrambled eggs (the army ruined them) and these looked just like army scrambled eggs. They didn't look fresh at all and I know I would never order them.    Update::: she heard me telling my friend when we got the bills and walks back to tell me I'm wrong, that what she wrote down is right. Even though I have never ordered scrambled eggs once in my life and everything on the plate was wrong.   I have never been treated so rudely by a server. I work in the industry so I get it. It can be a shitty job but if something is clearly wrong I fix it instead of being rude, condescending and mean.

Great Eats! Great quality food and they give you an abundance of it. The plates came quite fast and service was greeted with a smile. Food tasted sooo good, I had French Toast, Pork Sausage, Country style potatoes and eggs all for a very reasonable price.  Next time I'm in Toronto, this will be my regular spot to eat for breakfast.  Eat here for breakfast, you wont be sorry.  Cheers!

This place was only "ok".  Not downright bad, definitely not particularly good.  I got an omelet with pepper jack cheese and the "garden mix" (green peppers, onions, and celery).  It came with homefries and 3 pancakes.  All for just under $9.  Not a bad price considering the ridiculous amount of food you get, but I don't really NEED that much food, and it wasn't very good food.  The pancakes were pretty good; I had them with the wild berry sauce, since I can't stand that fake "maple" syrup that restaurants serve--so kudos to them for offering 3 different syrup choices for pancakes (maple syrup, wild berry syrup, and peach syrup).  The hashbrowns were also decent.  My omelet was pretty nasty and I ended up just eating half of it.  The pepper jack cheese tasted cheap and bland and the peppers onions and celery (....still a bit baffled by the inclusion of celery) was just not a great combo.  Kind of annoyed that cheese counts toward one of the "free" toppings in the "create your own omelet"...shouldn't an omelet just...COME with cheese?  I had a few sips of my boyfriend's coffee and it tasted pretty good.  Service was average, and we got our food fairly quickly.  The bill for the 2 of us came to about $22 (before tip).  We spent a couple bucks less at Courier Cafe last weekend, for better food and a more interesting atmosphere.  Definitely will be going back to Courier Cafe, not so sure about Perkins.

Wow, I love Perkins! I've been to this building in its many previous incarnations (Tucker's Marketplace, Chinese buffet) but this one has got to be my favourite.  I have come here a couple of times now, and plan on coming back regularly for breakfast.  It's a big space, and it's usually busy when I've come for breakfast on the weekend. The booth seats are kind of uncomfortable, but that's pretty much the only negative comment that I have.  When you order coffee, you get a whole pot at the table which is great for refills. I like getting the build-a-breakfast for $10.95, it's huge and a great deal! I usually get eggs, bacon, tater tots (soooo yum) and pancakes that actually taste light and fluffy. You also get your choice of three syrups. I want to try their cinnamon roll French toast next time...it sounds amazing! On my visits, the manager was very active in the restaurant and came by to make sure we were having a great visit. He asked how we heard about them, and thanked us for our business. You can sense that he truly does care about his patrons.  When you're done, they have some fresh baked pies and muffins to bring home too. Service has been fast and efficient, and I'm really happy that I have a new breakfast spot! I hope they are here to stay.

I've always enjoyed the food here but I've never been thrilled with the service.  Just yesterday I had to cue the server to take our order after being there for 20 min.  This surprised me because her tag was labeled as Supervisor.  I guess I had higher expectations of her.  Things were a bit better after this.    The restroom clearly hadn't been cleaned from the day before, so there was toilet paper on the floor, etc.  I didn't really care to see that at 9am.  I must note that there is a baby change table built into the counter top, which I'd never seen before.  Good idea.  I tried the Border Grilled Chicken Omelet, which is a calorie counter meal.  It is served with fruit and one piece of dry toast.  I quite enjoyed it and was grateful not to feel stuffed afterward, even though I ate it all.  From a pocketbook perspective, it was a steal.

Have not eaten at a Perkins in years.  My husband was hungry for pancakes and we were in the area of this restaurant for dinner.  He had the two pancakes, two sausage patties and two eggs and two toast menu item.  He said the pancakes and eggs were fine, the sausage and toast so-so.  I had a bite of his sausage Patti and it tasted really, really processed.    I had two potato pancakes that were surprisingly good.  They had chives in them and were crispy and tasty.  Not so much for the bacon that came with it.  The bacon was limp-not as cooked/crispy as I prefer.l however it had a smokey flavor that enhances the taste.  The cup of applesauce that came with it was nothing special.  Tastes like the apple sauce that comes out of a jar.  It would have been a tad better if it had been served warm.    We did not try any of the delectable bakery items they showcase by the checkout register.

I haven't been here for breakfast in a while. I used to go regularly because of the really great customer service & homey feel. Something has definitely changed. I noticed a lot of new faces. Took a while just to order coffee which never used to happen. And now they don't even have the turkey sausage I always used to order. Very disappointing...

Breakfast was good except for bitterest coffee in my life. Even pancake syrup was bitter. Waitress was inattentive. She brought cream when we asked for milk for coffee. She completely forgot we asked for water refill and disappeared. I usually give more tip but just gave 10% because of her poor service. Don't come on busy Saturday morning!

A place like Perkins delivers you exactly what you're looking for.  Consistency.  While nothing on their menu fills in the blank in "this place has the best _______", just about all of their menu entries are decent.    I'm a breakfast guy, so I like to order off that part of the menu when I can.  Their omelettes are very good - more filling than I always expect.  For me, all eggs require toast, so I get a little sad when I see that you get ONE side with your breakfast.  Well, I like hashbrowns (with cheese, of course), so I get that.  THEN I have to add toast.  Harrumph.  I guess there's worse things in the world than racking up your order...   Our recent visit to Perkins was on a holiday (Valentine's Day - no, it wasn't a date) on top of being a Sunday at 10:30am.  But, the glut of people in the lobby cycled through efficiently and we were seated in no time (not bad for a party of 6).  Service was solid, considering how packed the place was.    Perkins is a solid place to grab some food, coffee, or pastries.  While it's not the sexy "let's try something new and exotic" place, it's a good stand-by for a reliable meal with no surprises.

I got sick after eating here... never again. Is the kitchen dirty or what? I really wish there were more locally-owned late night places to eat. Also, the super sweet server working was clearly overwhelmed; I almost got up and started bussing tables for her.

Love Perkins for breakfast! Food was really good. Big portions and reasonable priced. This restaurant is always clean and the servers are really friendly. They have a new breakfast potato, and it was seasoned with some type of spices & so good. And they always have coupons online to use!!

This is a review based on coffee and dessert. and NOT the breakfasts.  Breakfasts are actually not bad, though I've had better (I'd say 2.5 stars for breakfast).    After a community event in the NE, I was trying to figure out a place to go for coffee and dessert, but the NE isn't exactly filled with many choices besides McDonalds.  Not feeling in the mood to drive  across town or go downtown with my aunt and friends, I decided to go to Perkins as it was the only place I could think of (it was a bakery too after all).  Boy was that a mistake.  Now the waitress, she was attentive, though she was trying to too hard to cover for the inadequacies of the kitchen.  It was 9pm on a saturday, at it was an empty restaurant.  I first ordered a cake on the menu.  Was then told that it wasn't available, and I had to choose something else.   I then ordered a brownie sundae.  After a few minutes, she came back and told me no brownies around, and told that they made very few in general and nothing was to be had.  She then went through with what they did had, and giving her and the resto one more chance, decided to take a chance on the lava cookie sundae.    Now a lava cookie should be warm, with gooey chocolate fudge in the center.  The heat and chocolate meant to compliment the coolness of the ice cream.  Wellll....  The cookie was dead cold.  Worse, the supposedly freshly described cookie was so hard, I honestly couldn't break it hitting it with my spoon.  And when I bit into it, it was just stale and unpleasant.  So much so, I lost my appetite altogether, and combined with the whole comedy of errors, I just left.  Sorry people, but to find out every choice I made missing and absent, and then be given a horrible dessert... well, I promised myself I won't make that mistake ever again.
I love the fact that this place is 24/7, there's not many places to get anything to eat late at night.  Also they have pie, so that's always a good thing.

Even though it is an incredibly busy evening with it being Saint Patricks day, the waitress was busy but still paid attention to her customers, greeted me with a smile along with an awesome attitude. The security guard stood off to the entrance the entire time I have been in the restaurant, guess I've never noticed the presence of a security guard any other night I've been in here. Customers seemed to be content this evening, one lady is just eating and reading her book, a few others are in conversations, a few late night dates are here, & just your average joe who works evenings, etc.  the service was super great, the food was good, and over all this was a great experience.

Perkins is a reliable choice when dining with my parents.  They like the choices between breakfast and dinner.  The addition of the Coca cola machine with so many flavors is great.   I lean to breakfasts when I go.  I liked my omelette with ham and veggies at this visit.  This location off of HWY 151 is crowded on weekends but it is big enough that the wait is not too bad.  Only negative is sometimes cleanliness is lacking.  But it has improved lately.

I stopped in with my girlfriend for lunch. We were seated right away. We decided to order from the smokehouse menu.  I got the BBQ pulled pork, slaw and fries, she got the brisket with baked beans and tots. We cut our sandwiches in half so we could share. The brisket was very good. The pulled pork was a bit peppery for my taste. The slaw tasted like it was missing something so I salted it and it was a little better, but I've had better. The baked beans were nothing special.   The server never came back to check on us to see if we needed anything and didn't offer to refill drinks until we were done eating.  This was only our second time there. We hope to get back and have the brisket before the summer is over.

I've always been OK with eating at Perkins. However, my recent experience was so unpleasant that I have to write about it. My vegetarian friend ordered a Baja Benedict which is basically vegetarian except for a couple of bacon pieces on top of the eggs. She clearly stated that she wanted Baja Benedict without bacon. Simple. When the food come out, there are bacon on top of the eggs and when she pointed out to the server she took my other friend's fork and scooped the bacon out in front of us - her filthy fingers touched the food I'm pretty sure. This is so unprofessional and not sanitary,

My wife and I went there for breakfast yesterday morning. We found the food to be very very bland and prepackaged type things similar to Denny's or Cora's. ( both of which we dislke ) The servings of meat are very small ( ie. 2 strips of bacon or sausage ), formerly frozen hash browns and I think scrambled eggs from a barrel or carton not a shell. The prices seemed high for what we got, the food was not served very hot and the coffee was $2.95 each as well.  We had the build a breakfast which is $8.95 on weekdays and $10.95 on weekends.  Service was not bad but we will not be returning due to the other factors I have listed.

We've tried this Perkin's a number of times, while the servers are very attentive and friendly, the muffins are delicious - a total MISS on their omelets and food.  We ate breakfast there yesterday, ordered an omelet and not only did it look disgusting, a thin egg with watery ingredients set inside and a half slice of cheese atop on a portion of the omelet.  To make things worse - egg shell in the omelet - it was a disgusting pile of mush.  We have breakfast there before and it wasn't this bad, but we've also tried it for dinner and it wasn't good.  Unfortunately, I doubt we'll now even return for breakfast after such a disgusting omelet.

I came here for breakfast a couple of months ago with a friend.. and I was craving for breakfast and he came to this place. We walked in the waitress asked for our license plates and to write it down.. I told her straight up we aren't going to do this.. and it's ridiculous and not even 5 star restaurants do that.. why are we going to give you our license plate number when this restaurant looks like we should be asking for the food certificate and other freaking licenses? She got offensive I can tell with the look on her face but I told her boldly,  grab us a seat please and don't give us a headache.. I came here to have breakfast and get out not for you to stalk me.. she rudely got us a seat at the back. I had the eggs Benedict and sausage and bread and it was decent.. Nothing to complain about but just because of that service alone, I would never come back here. Watch who you hire next time guys.. I always say, whoever you hire really and truly represents your company.. Becareful because you lose potential Regulars. Duh

Average food, comparable to food you would be served at Denny's. (I personally think Denny's is better). They have an "all you can eat pancakes" option for "late night bites" which is a little over $6 which includes 5 pancakes. They do not let you share and refuse to bring another plate when asked. Me and my boyfriend always feel sick to the stomach after hardly eating anything here.
Good food and nice waitresses but there was a very rude woman working the register. I just asked about the muffins deal and she was so upset and rude. Never coming here again.
I have not one good thing to say about Perkins except that it is finally closed!

Oh man, I can't really choose between Perkins and IHOP because they are both equally BAD. Perkins was dark and depressing and the food was extremely oily. Ask yourself: Do you want to start your day with breakfast (or lunch or dinner for that matter) at this place?
Wow.  Damn good salmon steak dinner, two sides (I got steamed veggies and tomato basil soup), and dinner roll.  All for $11.  Great stuff!

Thought we should try this place since we were visiting from California. Service was really bad! Didn't get our drinks til almost 30 minutes while people who came after us received their food and evrything first. Servers seems mad and annoyed. She rolled her eyes and was really rude. She wasnt helpful! Really don't recommend this place at all. PERIOD!!! Doesn't even deserve 1 star!!

Friday night was terrible. I had just picked my blind mother and her guide dog from Amtrak and got us all checked in at our hotel when my mom said she was very hungry. We both had never been to Champaign/Urbana so we were unsure of where to go. Like always I checked yelp. I found Perkins and we thought it sounded wonderful. We arrived at about 7:40pm. The hostess looked like she was getting ready to leave for the night, but seated us anyway. Things looked very promising. Our waiter came to the table and he seemed really nice. When it came time to order, he wrote nothing down. After he walked to the back, he came back out to the front and started playing on the claw machine for children. Another worker finally informed him he had food ready, which I thought it would be my mother's soup and salad. It turned out to be nothing apparently because he walked right back out with no food. I saw him go to 2 other tables checking up on them and bringing them out small items they requested. But there was absolutely no service for us. 25 minutes after we placed our order our drinks were empty and our salads and soup hadn't arrived. We ended up leaving the restaurant around 8:25 after not receiving any food. I informed what looked like a manager how long we were waiting and that we just decided to leave.  What a disappointment.

Anything outside of some pancakes is putrid. I ordered a dish with ham, potatoes (literal tater tots) and the most disgusting processed cheese.   If you're looking for quality breakfast food there are much better options including Giant Eagle where you can grab a box of Eggo Waffles.   However, the pancakes are quite good and I'd still give it a leg-up over Denny's if you need a quick bite at an odd hour.

Ever noticed as the music gets louder and wilder, the food and service get poorer. So with this place. Last year when I visited several times it was a pleasure. This year each visit keeps getting worst and worst. Why would management think they are catering to rock concert groupies? Could it be the hiring of cheap young inexperienced managers will ruin this chain too ? At least turn down our speakers if you are playing tunes(?) for the cooks!
I would study here late night because they offer the endless coffee pot where they will refill your coffee all night! I've also eaten breakfast here with my parents before a football game!
Bad service, super slow. Don't come here if you really wanna just get something to eat. 30 mins waiting, can't believe it. The server just drop the plates in my table, so rude!

Mediocre at best.  We were there for breakfast at 7am.  Coffee cups were brought to us ice cold.  The booster seat had a narrow bottom, which my son tipped over twice before I went out to the vehicle to get the one I remembered we had, but he was already too scared to sit in any booster.  The high chair brought for our 9 month old was sticky all over and even had large chunks of food from the previous child.  Kids can be brutal on those high chairs, ours no exception, so I don't expect them to be pristine, but that thing was downright nasty.  Finally, the regular syrup had a weird flavor I couldn't put my finger on at first, but finally decided it reminded me of cloves.  I love cloves in mulled cider and pumpkin pie, but not in maple syrup.  Besides, my spouse remembered the syrup being real maple syrup, not the imitation we were served.  This particular Perkins has been our first stop every time we get off the Amtrak over the last 10 years, but next time we will opt for Cracker Barrel.

We had a great experience during my first time here.  Our waitress was friendly, knowledgeable, and attentive.  We went for breakfast and it was delicious! The pancakes had crispy edges, and the hash browns were seasoned well.  It did take a little longer than I expected to get our food, but it was a busy Saturday morning.

I stopped by Perkins for a quick bite with my boss and a co-worker recently. I was not expecting much going in but it turned out to be a fairly pleasant experience. It's a really dated restaurant and the food was just average. That being said, portions are quite large, the items on the menu are inexpensive and the service we received was great!

Can I not even do a star? It was that bad! My friend and I just left perkins it was absolutely disgusting! Our sever was horrible and lacked people skills. Then when we got our food my plate was covered with little black curly hairs, so I can only assume there was hair in the food as well (and the food looked horrible anyways- I wouldn't eat it even if there wasn't hair!!), and when the server put down my friends plate on our table his chicken strips fell off the plate onto the table, and the server didn't even offer to bring him out different chicken. So we ended up leaving without eating. It was ridiculous! And I would not recommend anyone to go there! It was dirty, and the service was horrible and their food was just as bad! OVER ALL HORRIBLE!!!

U think this place is disgusting, im reviewing for the soul purpose of the story you're about to read.   A good buddy of mine went to lunch there with his son, who was 2 at the time, I believe. His mother was also in attendance, in the midst of wrapping up extras and exchanging money to pay the tab, there was a mix up.   A Big Mix Up! They walked out on the tab, not on purpose but the humorous part of the story, to me anyways, is the fact that not 1, or 2 but 3 generations of the family walked out on the tab. Wrong of me? I dont know, I found it pretty dam comical.   To wrap it up, Perkins is nasty and has bad service.

I hate leaving negative reviews (you can check my review history) and if I have something bad to say about a place, I tend to keep in to myself in hopes that it was just a fluke, but this was absolutely horrible.  My husband and I stopped here around midnight on our way back to Minnesota after a concert in Milwaukee.  There were 2 tables with a grand total of three patrons when we walked in.  We were not greeted, though the waitress looked right at us and knew we were there. After a minute, she told us she'd be with us in a minute. Okay, no problem.  We got seated and ordered, but it was apparent that we were inconveniencing her as she wrote down our order.   I ordered soft-poached eggs and toast, my favorite.  What I got, however, were two extremely hard-poached eggs.  I'm sorry, but that is unacceptable.  I am always wary about ordering poached eggs at a restaurant, because they can be tricky, but she said they do soft-poached. If you say your cook can do soft-poached, he should be able to do soft-poached.  Of course, Sunshine was nowhere to be found when I realized they were actually very hard, and I wouldn't have wanted to inconvenience her even more.  We ate and then waited for 5 minutes and were never brought our check, so we decided to just go up to the counter.  After a minute or two, our waitress came out with drinks for another table that had come in.  She saw us, didn't say anything and walked back into the kitchen.  We assumed she would be back momentarily, but she never did.  After 5 minutes, a kind woman who had a view of the kitchen said "Excuse me, there's people waiting at the counter."  After another minute, a woman came out with the title of manager on her name tag.  Shouldn't a manager be making sure that everything is running smoothly throughout the entire restaurant, to ensure customer happiness and comfortability??  At this point, there was at least 1 person on the floor for every 3 customers. There's no reason we should have waited so long.  I was a waitress throughout high school and college, so I know what it's like to have many things going on at once. It can be challenging, for sure, but it's very doable.  And as I already mentioned, there was hardly anybody in the place.    At least my cup of coffee kept me alert for the 3-hr ride home.  Perkins, get some new staff or train them to smile.

The food at Perkin's is consistently terrible.  The breakfast menu is decent but anything refered to as 'dinner' or 'salad' can be safely ignored.  Gets points for being open 24 hours and having a really eclectic mix of drunks at 2:45 AM.
Poor quality food. Overcharged and double charged for items. Disappointing. I have not found this with all Perkins, just this one.

The service is always great. The food is always good. The menu is loaded and varied. The deserts are fantastic.   The Wife and I go here often and have never been disappointed. One of our favorite places.

Sadly, yet another chain restaurant don't.  I went here with a bunch of my out-of-state relatives as well as my family and parents, and my dad nearly got food poisoning.  We went for brunch and the restaurant seemed like any old Perkins.  Everyone's food seemed fine, until my dad tried to cut into his fried fish.  Sure, it was fried on the outside, but the fish on the inside was semi-FROZEN.  How in the world do you serve deep fried frozen fish?  We told the server who got the manager and he apologized and gave my dad a $2 off voucher for his next meal.  Yes, that is right, Perkins wanted my dad to come back to their restaurant and eat another death-ensuring meal costing $2 less.  The manager did not even offer to compensate for my dad's entree or ask if he wanted anything else to eat instead.  Had Perkins handled the situation appropriately, I would have rated them better, but they seemed to have forgotten the customer in this case and did not understand that things could have been a lot worse.  The manager in this restaurant definitely needs to be retrained as do the cooks and those eating there should be advised that their food could also be just as inedible if they do not pay attention.

The service was horrible. We were waiting at the table for over 20 minutes before the waitress came to take our order. My wife and I walked out and the manager acted surprised when I told her we were very unhappy

Perkins is akin to Denny's or IHOP in my eyes and has food that is consistently lousy. That said, it's quite cheap and there are free refills on coffee and soda. I would say the pie is decent, at best.

Horrible.  I will never come back to this place. I came for breakfast and ordered the biscuit, gravy, sausage and bacon breakfast. The portions were very small.  I left there still hungry. The bacon looked and tasted like it had been thrown in the microwave for 30 sec then put on the plate.  Its the first time I have ever left bacon on my plate. Coffee was ok, and they left a caraff so you could refill it yourself.  I could see older people loving this place.

My family and I decided to try this place out for breakfast. We came in just before 8am on a Saturday morning and it was pretty dead inside. We were kindly greeted by a waitress as soon as entering and then quickly seated. Our booth was very roomy with a large table and brown leather banquets. After taking our drink orders she gave us time to flip through the menus.   I love that they offer all day breakfast here as well as fresh baked goods and pies. I particularly had my eye on the peanut butter silk cream pie but let's get through breakfast first.  Our waitress came back with our drinks and took our orders. Hubby ordered a coffee and they brought over a small carafe filled with coffee which I found to be a nice touch as you always had a hot refill waiting for you. I ordered a tea which also came with a small carafe of hot water and a tea bag on the side. However they serve Red Rose tea here which is one of my least favourite brands of tea...  Our food was ready in a short amount of time and we were ready to dig in. By this time the restaurant was starting to fill up so we were happy we just beat the rush of patrons coming in.  I decided to order the build a breakfast which comes with 2 eggs, choice of meat, choice of potatoes, and choice of bread item. I got scrambled eggs which were cooked simply and perfect, two slices of crispy turkey bacon, crispy hash browns which I loveddd - they are more like shredded potatoes that are browned on one side to get a nice crunchy golden brown crust and finally 3 buttermilk pancakes topped with a pat of butter. The pancakes were Soooo good!! Definitely the best part of my meal!! Thick, fluffy, buttery, and slightly sweetened. The pancakes come with a caddy of 3 different syrups to try but my favourite one was the berry flavoured one.  Hubby got the Triple Egg Dare ya which comes with 3 eggs, 3 slices applewood bacon, 3 sausage links, 2 buttermilk pancakes, 2 slices of french toast and crispy hash browns. He also really enjoyed his meal but his favourite part was the French Toast. Thick slices of sweet brioche bread perfectly cooked with a light dusting of powdered sugar and a pat of butter it was also heavenly!  Portions here were hugeee and we both could only tackle about half of our meals. We waited for a our waitress to return to ask to get it packed to go. Unfortunately our waitress took forever to return. I understand that restaurant was starting to get full at that time but she could of at least come back to check up on us. After finally getting her to get the takeout containers we needed another container and a bag for it all and again she went MIA. We flagged another waitress this time who kindly got us what we needed very quickly. Finally we waited on our waitress for a 3rd time because I still had my eye on getting a slice of that pie. When our waitress finally made a return she came to put the bill on the table without us even requesting it. I asked to order a slice of the pie and she graciously went to go check for me. Sadly the peanut butter pies were not ready yet so I didn't get my fix.  Overall I have to say the food was perfect! Hugeee portions at a reasonable price and everything was very tasty. The restaurant has a very homey feel and although service was fantastic in the beginning of our meal I wish it followed through as the restaurant got busier. However despite that little flub up I will still be making a return visit as I still have my eye on that pie!
